revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-12 13:18:59.000000000', 'message': "Add debian-stable nodeset

Today debian stretch is the current stable release of debian:

  https://wiki.debian.org/DebianReleases

Rather then adding debian-stretch as our default nodeset label, use
debian-stable. This should aid in the transition to debian-buster once
it is released. Since we don't plan to support long term releases of
debian, we can just update this nodeset once we are ready to switch to
buster over updating all projects intree jobs.

Change-Id: I91de606c52bd0571a04da7820214f5ed75c2caa7
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Add debian-stable nodeset

Today debian stretch is the current stable release of debian:

  https://wiki.debian.org/DebianReleases

Rather then adding debian-stretch as our default nodeset label, use
debian-stable. This should aid in the transition to debian-buster once
it is released. Since we don't plan to support long term releases of
debian, we can just update this nodeset once we are ready to switch to
buster over updating all projects intree jobs.

Change-Id: I91de606c52bd0571a04da7820214f5ed75c2caa7
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-11 14:11:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-11 14:13:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(9:11:31 AM) dhellmann: in parallel with the eventlet change we made a change that means all dependency specifications must match the global rules when any are changed
(9:11:41 AM) dhellmann: before we only checked the dependency spec being updated
(9:11:42 AM) mriedem: oh
(9:11:53 AM) mriedem: which is https://review.openstack.org/#/c/523387/32/requirements.txt
(9:11:54 AM) dhellmann: so if the requirements files aren't touched, everythying is fine
(9:11:59 AM) mriedem: yeah it is in that patch
(9:12:07 AM) dhellmann: but if anything is touched the whole file has to pass the tests
(9:12:28 AM) dhellmann: and I think they were running into an error because of eventlet when they added or changed something else
(9:12:36 AM) mriedem: ok, i guess i don't know if i should merge the eventlet uncap on its own, or tell them to include it in the zvm patch that changes requirements.txt
(9:12:47 AM) dhellmann: if it passes the tests you can merge it on its own
(9:12:49 AM) mriedem: i assume this is a foregone conclusion and we'll just need jichen's patch
(9:13:17 AM) mriedem: ok yeah so far passing unit and functional tests, so tempest should be fine"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-11 14:13:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-11 14:14:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

tl;dr - the check-requirements job was changed to not only check the then being changed, like in 523387, but to check everything, which is why it's failing on the eventlet thing. It sounds like we'll eventually need the eventlet uncap anyway, so we might as well just do it here."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-11 14:41:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Rephrase for multiattach support

Since we can enable attaching a volume to multiple servers,
the doc needs update.

Change-Id: Ide7c32f08113392b5f5e0042ec909b41c9cc6f88

commit_message:
Install client from pip if not in LIBS_FROM_GIT

It shouldn't be a requirement to put python-octaviaclient into
LIBS_FROM_GIT in local.conf. This commit makes Octavia's DevStack plugin
install it from pip if it's not present in LIBS_FROM_GIT.

Story: 2001830
Task: 12587
Change-Id: I37014a766e27f6117c96aef976fa1e0b5a9ca031

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-12 16:53:24.000000000', 'message': 'Pause ubuntu-xenial DIBs

We are seeing an issue with ubuntu-xenial DIBs in rackspace. Pause
nodepool-builder so we can revert to the previous days images until we
can properly debug the reason for the failure.

Change-Id: I8aa0e6efedb11f47eceb1a9961f84dbe609bfdcd
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Pause ubuntu-xenial DIBs

We are seeing an issue with ubuntu-xenial DIBs in rackspace. Pause
nodepool-builder so we can revert to the previous days images until we
can properly debug the reason for the failure.

Change-Id: I8aa0e6efedb11f47eceb1a9961f84dbe609bfdcd
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

Any hints on the mysterious requirements-check failures? Thanks!

It complains about mismatching min version, but the min versions are in line with https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blame/master/lower-constraints.txt and https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/master/global-requirements.txt

------

 Package u'oslo.i18n' is constrained to 3.20.0 which does not match the minimum version specifier 3.15.3 in requirements.txt
 Package u'pbr' is constrained to 3.1.1 which does not match the minimum version specifier 2.0.0 in requirements.txt
 Package u'babel' is constrained to 2.5.3 which does not match the minimum version specifier 2.3.4 in requirements.txt
 Package u'six' is constrained to 1.11.0 which does not match the minimum version specifier 1.10.0 in requirements.txt

 Package u'oslo.serialization' is constrained to 2.25.0 which does not match the minimum version specifier 2.18.0 in requirements.txt
 Package u'cliff' is constrained to 2.11.0 which does not match the minimum version specifier 2.8.0 in requirements.txt
 Validating lower constraints of test-requirements.txt
 Package u'sphinx' is constrained to 1.6.5 which does not match the minimum version specifier 1.6.2 in test-requirements.txt
 *** Incompatible requirement found!"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-12 14:41:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-04-12 15:18:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-04-12 18:26:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I65df598a852fdb75cebc0bb49c7aa7a0e7d7ab8c
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Initialize db for Barbican Keystone listener

Barbican keystone listener needs to have its db initialized.
Also adding barbican-keystone-listener to run in devstack.
Functional tests will be added in a subsequent commit.

Change-Id: Ie80a2e67a4ed4e62326b716b4925b7d4aa39eb77
Closed-Bug: 1750333

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

commit_message:
Replace insecure function eval

In neutronclient we use a eval function for processing
CLI neutron arguments. This function possible insecure because
eval get argument from client side. Instead of it we can use
a dict with allowed types which is more secure.

Closes-Bug: #1762938
Change-Id: Idde55d1b9206e9ef8742464825709f098d488a8e
Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-06 16:30:55.000000000', 'message': "uncap eventlet

This is the first step in the process...

1. uncap eventlet (this review)
2. push uncapped eventlet out via requirements updates to all consumers
3. make review in requirements changing upper-constraints.txt for
   eventlet
4. projects depend on requirements change to do work on the new eventlet
   the patch generated should merge into project without the
   requirements change merged (this means the change should pass in the
   dependant review (to test 0.22.1) AND in a separate non-dependant
   review (test the current constraint).  You would merge the
   non-dependant once both reviews are passing.
5. Once some non-determined set of projects work with the new eventlet
   we'd merge the updated upper-constraint into requirements.

Change-Id: Ia7d00e9cddca7908bc3c3ae64a58704fc4b27350
"}]
commit_message:
uncap eventlet

This is the first step in the process...

1. uncap eventlet (this review)
2. push uncapped eventlet out via requirements updates to all consumers
3. make review in requirements changing upper-constraints.txt for
   eventlet
4. projects depend on requirements change to do work on the new eventlet
   the patch generated should merge into project without the
   requirements change merged (this means the change should pass in the
   dependant review (to test 0.22.1) AND in a separate non-dependant
   review (test the current constraint).  You would merge the
   non-dependant once both reviews are passing.
5. Once some non-determined set of projects work with the new eventlet
   we'd merge the updated upper-constraint into requirements.

Change-Id: Ia7d00e9cddca7908bc3c3ae64a58704fc4b27350

commit_message:
Run playbooks with custom args

Add support to run each playbook with its custom args to override
default ones. Required in upgrades jobs to override release vars
when running upgrade playbook.

Change-Id: I060283f19a9738e55c2665b94eb1f746a790de1e

commit_message:
Add CACerts service to all scenario environment files

This service is needed to install CA certificates for the overcloud. We
need it because the plan is to enable public TLS by default. And without
this it won't work.

Change-Id: I168e6a543f7143900fdb855ec29d8532fb9736ae

commit_message:
test-install-keystone: Do not hardcode path for keystone-manage binary

When using the keystone distribution packages, the keystone binaries are
no longer installed in a virtual environment so we shouldn't hardcode
the paths to these binaries. It's preferred to set the PATH env variable
with all the possible paths and just call the binaries directly.

Change-Id: I1f5431bacc308b007b992a8b41bd4bd19635d551
Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages

[{'created': '2018-04-09 18:40:26.000000000', 'message': 'Update OS::TripleO::Services::ComputeNeutronCorePlugin for containers

Neutron ML2 plugin has been containerized, we need to switch
ComputeNeutronCorePlugin to use the containerized service in THT for the
Neutron ML2 plugin, otherwise Neutron will be configured on the host and
not in the container.

Change-Id: I744cde656cc827762b13995d05f8881d4da2b5b8
Closes-Bug: #1762504
'}]
commit_message:
Update OS::TripleO::Services::ComputeNeutronCorePlugin for containers

Neutron ML2 plugin has been containerized, we need to switch
ComputeNeutronCorePlugin to use the containerized service in THT for the
Neutron ML2 plugin, otherwise Neutron will be configured on the host and
not in the container.

Change-Id: I744cde656cc827762b13995d05f8881d4da2b5b8
Closes-Bug: #1762504

This would result in a file having the compute node and the

which could lead later on to improper parsing[1]

(cherry picked from commit ca46430dd2ea85fc34ea39fdc76cca4cab61b7f2)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix a nit in the oooq transformation process.

This would result in a file having the compute node and the
environment files on the same line:

  --compute-scale 0  -e /opt/stack/new/tripleo-ci/test-environments/worker-config.yaml \

which could lead later on to improper parsing[1]

[1] https://logs.rdoproject.org/55/559755/3/openstack-check/gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-container-to-container-upgrades-master-nv/Zd4c2be456ed34d239b58e830288b2421/undercloud/home/jenkins/overcloud_upgrade_prepare.sh.txt.gz

Change-Id: I5e9cf01e706411406b953d4c1a8e7443b328edd2
(cherry picked from commit ca46430dd2ea85fc34ea39fdc76cca4cab61b7f2)

commit_message:
Pass the execution id to AnsibleAction

In order to read the queue with the websocket
the execution id should be not None

Manual cherry pick
(Cherry-pick from: ef286afe5a2783c33c280507558474b23bce83dc)

Change-Id: I244e4676b90a891c65e1457204b7fe0f3ade261f

commit_message:
Make tempest API/Scenario tests voting

This patch is making the tempest API and scenario tests voting in gate.
This is highly desired because a non-voting job doesn't always get the
attention it needs.

Right now only the "test_router_interface_status" is currently failing
due to a known bug which is being tracked at [0]. I've disabled it and
left a FIXME not to remove the regex once the bug is fixed.

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/networking-ovn/+bug/1713835

Depends-On: If5098f6e60742421022712231589afe6755878dc
Change-Id: I2226e06e5b819ff39189cc125563dc1f3d1f93af

Create ansible-role-carbon repository

managing carbon. We won't be publishing to pypi or using official
documentation.

commit_message:
Create ansible-role-whisper repository

Create an ansible role to be used by windmill for the purpose of
managing whisper. We won't be publishing to pypi or using official
documentation.

Change-Id: I2c3f6a7e3c4081cd0ecc251cfa01ebaaa471fc34

commit_message:
Fixes mgmt net and flavor fact setting

This will fix the management network and flavor fact
setting which is not shared among multiple hosts
during install.

Closes-Bug: 1755929

Change-Id: I3b056b1ac7b7770926a79597744cbb48ef99fe63
(cherry picked from commit 758087197fc39577388c24cb375071e915166227)

commit_message:
Remove mox in unit/virt/xenapi/test_vm_utils.py (1)

This patch removes using mox in the following test classes.

* LookupTestCase
* XenAPIGetUUID
* FetchVhdImageTestCase

Subsequent patches will remove using mox in another test class
in nova/tests/unit/virt/xenapi/test_vm_utils.py.

Change-Id: Ie40f36b717d935d010e40d2ab29bac647c77b02d
Implements: blueprint mox-removal

commit_message:
Split glanceclient functional tests

Prepare for the Image API v1 to be removed from glance during Rocky
by splitting the functional tests that hit v1 from the tests that hit
v2.  Introduce a new job that runs the functional-v1 tests against a
devstack running glance stable/queens, and configure this job for both
check and gate for the glanceclient.  The v2 functional tests
continue to be run for both check and gate against a devstack running
glance master.

Change-Id: Ifa98ada26a84e4cca3ea8c98173f61a6174cca27

commit_message:
Strip the version prefix from the next link for pagination

keystoneauth1 appends the version prefix to the url causing the
pagination url to be incorrect when using the url prefix from
next link. Thus we are stripping the version prefix from the
next link for pagination to work correctly

Change-Id: Iad8e69d20783cfe59c3e86bd6980da7dee802869
Closes-Bug: 1748534

commit_message:
dev mode: Add support for etcd

Provide support fot kolla dev mode in Magnum. When
'kolla_dev_mode' or 'etcd_dev_mode' variables are
enabled, source code of Magnum project is cloned
and bindmounted.

Partially implements: blueprint mount-sources

Change-Id: Icf638dda72993e5f4bbe06d8668b36c7a86541fb

subject: Use first conductor for nova-manage cell_v2 discover_hosts
messages:
[{'account_id': 24132, 'date': '2018-04-11 12:00:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-04-11 12:05:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Looks straightforward. I'm curious whether it solves the issue that's been seen."}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-04-11 12:07:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 24132, 'date': '2018-04-11 12:26:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 24132, 'date': '2018-04-11 12:27:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 19298, 'date': '2018-04-11 12:50:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11069, 'date': '2018-04-11 15:28:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

DISCLAIMER: All my analysis and testing has been on the stable/pike branch.

I tested the stable/pike branch both before and after this change, and multiple times as the previous implementation had a random element to it so failure was statistical (N-1/N where N is number of nova-conductor containers).

Test procedure: "openstack-ansible setup-openstack.yml -l nova_compute -vvvv"

Test environment: 3 infra nodes (each with nova-conductor container), 2 nova-compute nodes, and 1 deploy node (from which openstack-ansible is executed on, but not deployed to).

Before proposed change: passed 33% of the time (2 out of 6 attempts)
After proposed change: passed 100% of the time (6 out of 6 attempts)

Yes, technically with the removal of the random Jinja2 filter multiple "after" tests were not required, but done just for completeness, apples-to-apples comparisons, etc.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-04-11 15:30:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Thanks for the feedback Corey, looks like this should go ahead.'}, {'account_id': 24132, 'date': '2018-04-12 08:56:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I applied this patch in a production cluster and it solved the cell_v2 discover_hosts error.'}, {'account_id': 24132, 'date': '2018-04-12 11:06:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-04-12 12:49:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-04-12 12:50:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-04-12 12:50:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Use first conductor for nova-manage cell_v2 discover_hosts

Using a random conductor leads to unpredictable results with lazy eval

Change-Id: I846f78c80e4b5eb8421dbdebf3fc943be0bc84df

Who are we protecting by defaulting it to 0? Is there a case I'm missing?"}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-02-04 22:31:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)

I left it disabled by default to match the HAProxy and previous behavior. I don't like adding a delay to packet flows that users can stumble into.
I.e. If the user has a TCP listener, with a default pool, but adds an L7 rule for an edge case, the main flow to the default pool will be delayed."}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-02-05 18:44:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Bumping this to Rocky, reconsidering if this should just be part of the user timeout settings.'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2018-02-05 18:47:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

To your example:
>> I.e. If the user has a TCP listener, with a default pool, but adds an L7 rule for an edge case, the main flow to the default pool will be delayed.
That's exactly when I'd expect we SHOULD do a default -- because their L7 rule probably wouldn't match right most of the time, and they'd have no idea why, and since it was an edge case they might not even notice.

Granted, the more I think about this, the more I think it might really belong as a user-option per LB or Listener, and not as a global operator setting."}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-02-05 18:54:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This was included here: https://review.openstack.org/555454'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-31 00:02:35.000000000', 'message': 'Add haproxy_tcp_request_inspect_delay config

If a user setup a TCP listener and then applied L7 rules to the listener
connections may fall through to the default pool even though they match the
L7 rule(s). This is because with a TCP listener HAProxy inspects the first
packet received with no delay. This first packet may not include the header
information required to match the L7 rule.
This patch add a configuration setting that allows the operator to specify the
delay time HAProxy will wait for additional TCP packets before it gives up
on matching the L7 rule(s).
This setting is off by default and is only enabled for TCP listeners with
L7 rules. Enabling it may inject artificial delay into processing TCP flows
when L7 rules are enabled on TCP listeners.
To avoid this delay, when using HTTP based L7 rules, specify an HTTP listener.

Change-Id: Ide52d77e993ae30675f6faf08a85bc9d2d61f135
Story: 2001425
Task: 6131

This patch add a configuration setting that allows the operator to specify the

on matching the L7 rule(s).
This setting is off by default and is only enabled for TCP listeners with
L7 rules. Enabling it may inject artificial delay into processing TCP flows
when L7 rules are enabled on TCP listeners.

Change-Id: Ide52d77e993ae30675f6faf08a85bc9d2d61f135

commit_message:
Add haproxy_tcp_request_inspect_delay config

If a user setup a TCP listener and then applied L7 rules to the listener
connections may fall through to the default pool even though they match the
L7 rule(s). This is because with a TCP listener HAProxy inspects the first
packet received with no delay. This first packet may not include the header
information required to match the L7 rule.
This patch add a configuration setting that allows the operator to specify the
delay time HAProxy will wait for additional TCP packets before it gives up
on matching the L7 rule(s).
This setting is off by default and is only enabled for TCP listeners with
L7 rules. Enabling it may inject artificial delay into processing TCP flows
when L7 rules are enabled on TCP listeners.
To avoid this delay, when using HTTP based L7 rules, specify an HTTP listener.

Change-Id: Ide52d77e993ae30675f6faf08a85bc9d2d61f135
Story: 2001425
Task: 6131

commit_message:
Allow for more overhead in zaqar message

We need to account for more overhad when chunking the message before
posting it to the zaqar queue as JSON encoding also adds to the overall
message length. This changes the overhead ratio from 90% down to 50%.

This would result in more smaller messages going through the queue. I
don't see any drawbacks with that though given this zaqar is not tenant
facing and is on the undercloud.

Change-Id: I79535bb276a7f763da575a022486590c117579b0

commit_message:
Break up the HTTP guideline into smaller documents

The current HTTP guideline is very, very large. It will be more easily
discovered and consumed by breaking it up into logical chunks.

Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Tantsur <dtantsur@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I964b1f31e50c93f59e5dc07d7643c6c21b51f762

subject: Add support for key manager configuration
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-12 15:47:21.000000000', 'message': "Add support for key manager configuration

A support for propagation of key manager configuration from
calling charms into OSD preparation codepaths; this is used
predominately in the 'vault' key management approach where
the block device is encrypted outside of ceph-volume/ceph-disk
vs the 'ceph' key management approach where ceph tools take
responsibility for management of the keys lower down the stack.

The 'vault' key management approach is integrated in the
_initialize_disk function - if vault is selected as the key
manager, then vaultlocker is used to encrypt and open the disk;
the resulting /dev/mapper/crypt-<UUID> device is then used
for LVM, rather than the underlying partition.

Change-Id: Icdde1f128641573d7e49796961e63508b715e18b
"}]
commit_message:
Add support for key manager configuration

A support for propagation of key manager configuration from
calling charms into OSD preparation codepaths; this is used
predominately in the 'vault' key management approach where
the block device is encrypted outside of ceph-volume/ceph-disk
vs the 'ceph' key management approach where ceph tools take
responsibility for management of the keys lower down the stack.

The 'vault' key management approach is integrated in the
_initialize_disk function - if vault is selected as the key
manager, then vaultlocker is used to encrypt and open the disk;
the resulting /dev/mapper/crypt-<UUID> device is then used
for LVM, rather than the underlying partition.

Change-Id: Icdde1f128641573d7e49796961e63508b715e18b

subject: Don't persist RequestSpec.retry
messages: [{'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-12 16:05:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-12 16:07:38.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nrebase squash failure'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-12 16:05:00.000000000', 'message': "Don't persist RequestSpec.retry

During a resize, the RequestSpec.flavor is updated
to the new flavor. If the resize failed on one host
and was rescheduled, the RequestSpec.retry is updated
for that failed host and mistakenly persisted, which
can affect later move operations, like if an admin
targets one of those previously failed hosts for a
live migration or evacuate operation.

This change fixes the problem by not ever persisting
the RequestSpec.retry field to the database, since
retries are per-request/operation and not something
that needs to be persisted.

Alternative to this, we could reset the retry field
in the RequestSpec.reset_forced_destinations method
but that would be slightly overloading the meaning
of that method, and the approach taken in this patch
is arguably cleaner since retries shouldn't ever be
persisted. It should be noted, however, that one
advantage to resetting the 'retry' field in the
RequestSpec.reset_forced_destinations method would
be to avoid this issue for any existing DB entries
that have this problem.

The related functional regression test is updated
to show the bug is now fixed.

NOTE(mriedem): This backport also includes change
I61f745667f4c003d7e3ca6f2f9a99194930ac892 squashed
into it in order to not re-introduce that bug. On
Ocata it must be adjusted slightly to pass a string
rather than list to _wait_for_migration_status
since I752617066bb2167b49239ab9d17b0c89754a3e12 is
not in Ocata.

NOTE(mriedem): This patch has to pull some changes
from two other patches to make live migration work
in the fake virt driver: ce893e37f and b97c433f7.

Change-Id: Iadbf8ec935565a6d4ccf6f36ef630ab6bf1bea5d
Closes-Bug: #1718512
(cherry picked from commit 6647f11dc1aba89f9b0e2703f236a43f31d88079)
(cherry picked from commit 757dbd17cf37aecea005dfdc954bf50bbddedd95)
(cherry picked from commit 878e99d1f82fbeec840b2dbab8e40c27127d88ba)

Fix race fail in test_resize_with_reschedule_then_live_migrate

The assertion in the test that the migration status is 'completed'
is flawed in that it assumes when the instance status is 'ACTIVE'
the migration is completed, which isn't True, since the instance
status gets changed before the migration is completed, but they are
very close in time so there is a race, which is how this test slipped
by. This fixes the issue by polling the migration status until it
is actually completed or we timeout.

Change-Id: I61f745667f4c003d7e3ca6f2f9a99194930ac892
Closes-Bug: #1762876
(cherry picked from commit 4afa8c2b97929faaf8bbf2bbaa72235fab7d3d13)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't persist RequestSpec.retry

During a resize, the RequestSpec.flavor is updated
to the new flavor. If the resize failed on one host
and was rescheduled, the RequestSpec.retry is updated
for that failed host and mistakenly persisted, which
can affect later move operations, like if an admin
targets one of those previously failed hosts for a
live migration or evacuate operation.

This change fixes the problem by not ever persisting
the RequestSpec.retry field to the database, since
retries are per-request/operation and not something
that needs to be persisted.

Alternative to this, we could reset the retry field
in the RequestSpec.reset_forced_destinations method
but that would be slightly overloading the meaning
of that method, and the approach taken in this patch
is arguably cleaner since retries shouldn't ever be
persisted. It should be noted, however, that one
advantage to resetting the 'retry' field in the
RequestSpec.reset_forced_destinations method would
be to avoid this issue for any existing DB entries
that have this problem.

The related functional regression test is updated
to show the bug is now fixed.

NOTE(mriedem): This backport also includes change
I61f745667f4c003d7e3ca6f2f9a99194930ac892 squashed
into it in order to not re-introduce that bug. On
Ocata it must be adjusted slightly to pass a string
rather than list to _wait_for_migration_status
since I752617066bb2167b49239ab9d17b0c89754a3e12 is
not in Ocata.

NOTE(mriedem): This patch has to pull some changes
from two other patches to make live migration work
in the fake virt driver: ce893e37f and b97c433f7.

Change-Id: Iadbf8ec935565a6d4ccf6f36ef630ab6bf1bea5d
Closes-Bug: #1718512
(cherry picked from commit 6647f11dc1aba89f9b0e2703f236a43f31d88079)
(cherry picked from commit 757dbd17cf37aecea005dfdc954bf50bbddedd95)
(cherry picked from commit 878e99d1f82fbeec840b2dbab8e40c27127d88ba)

Fix race fail in test_resize_with_reschedule_then_live_migrate

The assertion in the test that the migration status is 'completed'
is flawed in that it assumes when the instance status is 'ACTIVE'
the migration is completed, which isn't True, since the instance
status gets changed before the migration is completed, but they are
very close in time so there is a race, which is how this test slipped
by. This fixes the issue by polling the migration status until it
is actually completed or we timeout.

Change-Id: I61f745667f4c003d7e3ca6f2f9a99194930ac892
Closes-Bug: #1762876
(cherry picked from commit 4afa8c2b97929faaf8bbf2bbaa72235fab7d3d13)

commit_message:
Run with KVM if we can in tests

We should not Set nova_virt_type.
This way detection steps in, and kvm is used.

However, we should use qemu for OVH hosts:
There seem to be a bug in some OVH hosts
causing 'hardware error 0x0' when trying to run with kvm.

This is a manual-cherry pick of the following commits:

Allow to run tests outside openstack infra:
  I782bc40a6ce192b705d7d08a578fdf6275b9a13e
Run with KVM if we can in tests:
  I4f679815ac55095000dc1017cebbd1a8bf0f6c5f
Use the right hypervisor name for ovh hosts:
  Ib07a93db1d0f826701fd58f95243eb17ef017e4b

(cherry picked from commit 17439c210cfdf1b22980cb68db3d29dbb41963eb)
(cherry picked from commit b3a5751048bcfd9b4eb176591ce3f735ea05bc86)
(cherry picked from commit 748e3d22925ff9cfe8baba087f37b26988f9e1e0)
(cherry picked from commit 41c59c7908cd728a74cfac10c03150020b4d8729)
(cherry picked from commit 5d161fb73176e92b0097f615700275918714f27c)

Change-Id: I7a5e15f84d4cd7b3a121a2275cd4ab7b961829f5

commit_message:
Initial support for Prometheus monitoring

This adds support for running a Prometheus server and a few exporters
that already have existing Kolla images (node exporter, haproxy exporter
and mysqld exporter).

Partially-Implements: blueprint prometheus
Change-Id: I69e648c05b2bb27aa2f5973dec3a58b75850eeee

Closes-Bug: #1763300

commit_message:
Do not delegate to omit

delegate_to should never delegate to omit, as omit is only
intended for task argument's values.
More explanations of the reasons can be found in the bug.

Change-Id: Iaeed4026962e635f68013ff8d175f0e20bffe415
Closes-Bug: #1763300

commit_message:
Octavia assert tests-lower-dependency-bounds tag

The Octavia projects have voting and passing lower dependency gate jobs, so
assert the tests-lower-dependency-bounds tag on those projects.

The merged patches for reference:
octavia: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/555965/
octavia-dashboard: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/555967/

that sounds fair, in that case we should probably wait til doug says things have died down enough (since he submitted the addition of the jobs to the projects)'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-03-29 19:57:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> that sounds fair, in that case we should probably wait til doug
 > says things have died down enough (since he submitted the addition
 > of the jobs to the projects)

Waiting a bit is a good idea. That will give the TC time to agree to the language, and we can add the project list before the final version of the patch is voted on.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-03-30 03:30:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

FYI, octavia has a child patch that includes the octavia projects. This could be merged into this patch.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-03-30 08:13:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Rollcall-Vote-1

While I agree with the idea here, the goal of tags is to communicate valuable information to consumers of OpenStack deliverables, not really to track improvements in adhering to dependency management norms... It needs to have a user-visible effect.

I wonder if we should not track that using a status page, then have a community-wide goal to catch stragglers, then make it a requirement to become an openstack project... We did not have a does-not-include-oslo-code-copies tag to track progress removing such code. Or is it something we don't expect everyone to adopt ?

If we keep it as a tag, I'd at least rephrase it in terms of consumer benefits."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-03-30 08:13:21.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from add-tests-lower-dependency-bounds-tag to formal-vote'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-04-03 14:27:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Rollcall-Vote-1

I agree with Thierry here. This seems like an odd tag to have.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-03 17:28:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> While I agree with the idea here, the goal of tags is to
 > communicate valuable information to consumers of OpenStack
 > deliverables, not really to track improvements in adhering to
 > dependency management norms... It needs to have a user-visible
 > effect.
 > 
 > I wonder if we should not track that using a status page, then have
 > a community-wide goal to catch stragglers, then make it a
 > requirement to become an openstack project... We did not have a
 > does-not-include-oslo-code-copies tag to track progress removing
 > such code. Or is it something we don't expect everyone to adopt ?
 > 
 > If we keep it as a tag, I'd at least rephrase it in terms of
 > consumer benefits.

The point of adding the lower-bounds testing at all, rather than continuing to force projects to update lower-bounds relentlessly as we move them for any component, is to show that project teams are keeping up with which of their dependencies they actually need to be new. That information is allegedly useful for two cases. The first is deployers who are not using distro packages, and therefore need to choose their own versions of packages to install. The second is the distros, who may not package the versions in our upper-constraints.txt list because they need to maintain compatibility with other things distributed on their platform.

So the message to users is that a deliverable with this tag has its dependency list managed in a way that is not just slapping the latest version number of everything into a text file, but actually verifies that older versions of libraries do at least pass some basic tests for the project."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-04-04 08:05:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> So the message to users is that a deliverable with this tag has its
 > dependency list managed in a way that is not just slapping the
 > latest version number of everything into a text file, but actually
 > verifies that older versions of libraries do at least pass some
 > basic tests for the project.

I completely agree with the value for projects to follow that rule, I just consider the value for users to be indirect, and therefore the tag not to answer a clear user question.

Back when tags were added, there was this fear that we would get tags for everything, and what would make a good tag. We clearly set the bar that tags are meant to answer questions that our users have, when considering which components to deploy.

This just feels a bit too... abstract for me to pass that bar, at least with the current name and description. As an example, we don't have a tag that says "implements functional testing" or "does not include copies of oslo libraries" -- because while the user benefits from it, those tags do not really answer a question that users have when considering projects they might want to deploy.

Personally I feel like lower-dependency-bounds testing is something all OpenStack projects should have (same as global requirements). We should set a goal in a future cycle to get all projects up to snuff and make it a policy requirement from there on. Or do you expect that some projects will never ever implement lower-dependency-bounds testing ?'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-04-05 11:16:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)

I've got mixed feelings on this. I agree that making lots of random tags can result in too many tags, many of them too abstract, and the value of having a tag being fairly dilute.

On the other hand, tags are currently one of the more concrete modes whereby we can drive policy (another is community-wide goals) and frequently frustrated by how little we (the TC) drive.

I'm fairly agnostic about the value of lower bounds testing (mostly because I think people should run things in isolation and generally use "new stuff", but I also recognize that's not always possible) so I've not got a strong opinion here.

But, as usual, I'm concerned with the general issues raised.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-12 15:25:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Based on our discussion last week I think we can abandon this. I'll work with the requirements team on a goal if we don't complete the testing roll-out this cycle."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-04-12 15:26:38.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Let's do it as a goal instead"}]

commit_message:
sphinxext: Start parsing 'Opt.help' as rST

Users expect this to be parsed as rST and write their docstrings
accordingly. This has the potential to introduce warnings for users with
improperly formatted rST and these warnings can be promoted to errors if
'sphinx-build' is used with the '-W' option. As a result, we disable the
'warning-is-error' logger for these options. We may wish to change this
behavior in the future.

It is not really possible to test this yet as the output wouldn't look
much different. In addition, the error messages generated are rather
unhelpful. Both of these can be changed in a future modification.

Change-Id: Ic6c2dcbe7823dd3fdc71db8dc5afab2d604559e3
Closes-Bug: #1755783

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-12 05:34:30.000000000', 'message': 'Several manage_shard_ranges improvements

...mainly around locking and timeouts.

- Add broker.updated_timeout() context manager to temporarily override a
  broker's timeout.
- Add --replace-timeout and --enable-timeout options to
  manage_shard_ranges to take advantage of the above.
- Use execute (rather than executescript) in the CREATE TABLE migration
  so we actually get the benefit of our GreenDBConnection to retry
  within the timeout.
- Move the setting of Scan-Done metadata to *after* the merging of shard
  ranges, to reflect the order done in the sharder.
- Emit range-finding progress in find_and_replace command.
- Other clean up:
    - Drop unnecessary dict copying.
    - Drop an unnecessary "True and" clause.
    - Have non-None returns for replace_shard_ranges and
      find_replace_shard_ranges.

Change-Id: I7ec72f3febbe96c6aa110a1a123336ac06ffd1c4
'}]
commit_message:
Several manage_shard_ranges improvements

...mainly around locking and timeouts.

- Add broker.updated_timeout() context manager to temporarily override a
  broker's timeout.
- Add --replace-timeout and --enable-timeout options to
  manage_shard_ranges to take advantage of the above.
- Use execute (rather than executescript) in the CREATE TABLE migration
  so we actually get the benefit of our GreenDBConnection to retry
  within the timeout.
- Move the setting of Scan-Done metadata to *after* the merging of shard
  ranges, to reflect the order done in the sharder.
- Emit range-finding progress in find_and_replace command.
- Other clean up:
    - Drop unnecessary dict copying.
    - Drop an unnecessary "True and" clause.
    - Have non-None returns for replace_shard_ranges and
      find_replace_shard_ranges.

Change-Id: I7ec72f3febbe96c6aa110a1a123336ac06ffd1c4

Bug fix: Parenthesis needed when using ternary

neutron_fwaas and neutron_fwaas_v2 where always false. When using
ternary, the condition must be inside parenthesis

Change-Id: Ifa33e5aedd06e1c0cc44d03354d56de18db46932
Signed-off-by: Manuel Buil <mbuil@suse.com>
(cherry picked from commit cb25b3cc59f7dfdcf3e54b1e23e66dc1bf7d3c62)

commit_message:
Restrict legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src job

The legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src job isn't relevant to
documentation or release notes changes, so save resources by
not running it on such jobs.

For example, see [0] which is a glanceclient release notes
change (and also a failed attempt to apply irrelevant-files in
the glanceclient repo, hence this patch).

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/559825/

Change-Id: I167e2904bc386dc44ec1986945860e286022d06b

commit_message:
Simplify the TripleO install guide

This patch is simplifying the TripleO deployment guide by:

* Removing the baremetal instructions since it's not recommended anymore
* Adding a ovn.yml file to generate the correct overcloud-deploy.sh and
  overcloud-prep-containers.sh scripts
* Clarifying some steps about deploying directly on the localhost
* Replace the workaround that was manually creating the
  network-environment.yaml file with a simpler workaround using ansible
  tags (lol, I know right?!)

Note: The tripleo/ovn.yaml could probably live in the tripleo-quickstart
repository (under config/general_config). This patch is adding it to the
networking-ovn tree for simplicity (likely we have a .sample config file
for DevStack). We can always move it later to the tripleo-quickstart
repository if we see the need for it.

Co-Authored-By: Numan Siddique <nusiddiq@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie38fcca8ce8334bed6acc827a136656d2c5da3d0

commit_message:
Do not delegate to omit

delegate_to should never delegate to omit, as omit is only
intended for task argument's values.
More explanations of the reasons can be found in the bug.

Change-Id: Ic00c5d6eeee8858a7bc6bd47a95782374eedb944
Closes-Bug: #1763300

An IRC channel for openstack-placement has been created to cut down
on the amount of placement-only traffic in #openstack-nova. This
adds gerritbot and accessbot entries for the new channel, which
has been registed and granted for 'openstackinfra' as described in
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/system-config/irc.html

commit_message:
Add entries for #openstack-placement IRC channel

An IRC channel for openstack-placement has been created to cut down
on the amount of placement-only traffic in #openstack-nova. This
adds gerritbot and accessbot entries for the new channel, which
has been registed and granted for 'openstackinfra' as described in
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/system-config/irc.html

A subsequent patch in system-config will add support for meetbot
and statusbot.

Change-Id: Ib5e9f7252343b1ced0ad482c516ce5c17652b64e

messages: [{'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2018-04-12 14:00:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2018-04-12 14:06:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2018-04-12 14:34:14.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nPosted on wrong branch, see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560915/'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-12 14:00:35.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Deprecate management of self-signed SSL certificates

This feature is disabled by default, and a majority of our
users provide certificates managed elsewhere through
configuration.

At present the cluster relation carries information required
for this feature even when it is not enabled. This makes
processing of cluster relation changes unnecessarily heavy
and vulnerable to bugs.

Change-Id: I8b07c7e0d5c2c623c115c83dc8aff230b554a986
Closes-Bug: #1755897
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Deprecate management of self-signed SSL certificates

This feature is disabled by default, and a majority of our
users provide certificates managed elsewhere through
configuration.

At present the cluster relation carries information required
for this feature even when it is not enabled. This makes
processing of cluster relation changes unnecessarily heavy
and vulnerable to bugs.

Change-Id: I8b07c7e0d5c2c623c115c83dc8aff230b554a986
Closes-Bug: #1755897

First of all, please write a commit message that explains what happens here.
Then please file a bug in Launchpad and mention it in the commit message.
Also, this is a workaround. Why don't we fix the RPM to deploy the user?"}, {'account_id': 21151, 'date': '2018-03-30 01:24:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> First of all, please write a commit message that explains what
 > happens here.
 > Then please file a bug in Launchpad and mention it in the commit
 > message.
 > Also, this is a workaround. Why don't we fix the RPM to deploy the
 > user?

Thanks for the review! 
Will report a bz,  link to the commit message then explain why this is needed.
Re workaround: Yes, ideally this should be fixed in package itself by adding a section of preinstall scriptlet to create openvswitch user, but we're about to support ovs2.9 in osp10 and cannot wait until the fix is landed in ovs which takes a long time. This is to add a workaround in tripleo to create user before doing package update and shall be deleted once ovs has the fix ready."}, {'account_id': 21151, 'date': '2018-03-30 01:50:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-04-03 07:33:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Ensure openvswitch user exist before package update

Ovs uses openvswitch user when updating package to 2.8
onwards, but openvswitch user is not exist and will not
be created during package update. This is going to add
workaround to make sure openvswitch user exist before
running package update.

Related-Bug: #1759982
Co-Authored-By: Yolanda Robla Mota <yroblamo@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I913e56c676890c4071f60aa190d02bfaca264d76
(cherry picked from commit 1051fbe10b443801c96a4efaff7acc8697e3fa5d)

commit_message:
Enable missing support for large objects in Swift

The slo and dlo middlewares are required to enable support for large
objects (> 5GB). Also enabling the copy & versioned_writes middleware,
which enables object copying and versionining.

Closes-Bug: 1761412
Change-Id: Iff73833f1d470750862873f70a4a9aaba50bd164
(cherry picked from commit ea55f3de1296407acef8cd1ae5ea2df0e70b4350)

commit_message:
Add validation task in docker services [Sahara]

Docker services are missing the pre-upgrade validation task
in the upgrade_tasks section which verifies if the service
is running before going on with the upgrade.

(cherry picked from 133d9a2a962c2600632e88bedfbc39e19c48ebf1)
Change-Id: I41088442f29e99c553312d0e4303ea3db6df8dad

commit_message:
Use new ceph/daemon tags

The newer naming scheme replaces 'tag' with an actual version
number and appends the target architecture to the tag name.

Ultimately it allows us to pin to 'known to work' builds of the
images.

Change-Id: If080fa40f674cb9254f2b411c59f88ac54c74d12

subject: uncap eventlet
messages:
[{'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-11 16:07:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-04-12 07:29:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The trove-scenario-postgresql-single job failed because of network issues.

The true problem is the requirements-check jobs.'}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-04-12 11:59:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I came up with:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560856/
firstly to fix the lower-constraints.txt(the fix mainly produced by tools/fix-lower-constraints.py from the requirements repo, thanks a lot for the script, :)), but finally I found the eventlet uncapping should also be included to make the requirements-check gate job passing, so I merged all these changes in that patch.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-12 14:20:43.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoning in favor of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560856/2'}]

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I7f367e7f92494b51a49fee6dbc2b79e2ad30d920
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Stop persisting previous configuration on update/upgrade prepare

We've been getting a number of errors related to this persistence
(e.g. LP#1758406 or rhbz#1541024). It doesn't seem feasible to
continue to fix them one by one, we should go back to requiring users
pass their -e files to the prepare command.

Related-Bug: #1758406
Change-Id: I9db2c9256ed20d4d0b74bb467ee6ae0a9633bcc8

commit_message:
Define overcloud_docker_registry_namespace for rdocloud

container-to-container tests were failing with the
incorrect namespace for the overcloud containers as they were
not defined for rdocloud.

Change-Id: Ica2dc014e195e1912b7878e777a36a231d2ad668

commit_message:
masquerade: configure FORWARD rules

When enabling masquerading, we need to allow the traffic to go through
so we need the FORWARD rules as well, for source and destination
networks.
Also support multiple destinations or sources for ipv4/ipv6 suffixed
rules with a REGEX.

Change-Id: I48aa95b96c762a72273b5b0b714a04da7ee69a40

commit_message:
Download TripleO packages from "centos7-queens"

This patch is updating the tripleo-ci/queens.yaml file configuration
file to make it download the TripleO patches from the "centos7-queens"
mirror instead.

Without this patch, the tripleo gate job for networking-ovn was failing
with the message below because it couldn't find the DLRN hash in the
"centos7" mirror (without -queens):

2018-02-23 13:10:40 | Failed to parse dlrn hash
2018-02-23 13:10:40 | + exit 1

Change-Id: I3ea043758f813f33b4e42eae29b12fadd2e66f7c

commit_message:
Enable extras repo when updating containers

Some updates may need to use dependencies from the extras
repo which are not in base. This is the case of python-crypto
required in ansible update [1]

[1] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/13254/

Change-Id: Ic01eb82e6c110be4918272112ba26521964f2cc9

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-11 16:03:25.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: Fix DNS Recordset CRUD to use IDs

This is checking if I60d6400631f31cba89a6d07382c380006bd2ded2
fixes the broken test.

If a zone name is supplied to a recordset function
we should lookup the ID to use that in the URL,
as the name in the URL will return a 404.

Also harmonised the naming of vars in the recordset
section to make this clearer.

Change-Id: I60d6400631f31cba89a6d07382c380006bd2ded3
Signed-off-by: Graham Hayes <gr@ham.ie>
'}, {'created': '2018-04-12 09:19:01.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: Fix DNS Recordset CRUD to use IDs

This is checking if I60d6400631f31cba89a6d07382c380006bd2ded2
fixes the broken test.

If a zone name is supplied to a recordset function
we should lookup the ID to use that in the URL,
as the name in the URL will return a 404.

Also harmonised the naming of vars in the recordset
section to make this clearer.

Change-Id: I60d6400631f31cba89a6d07382c380006bd2ded3
Signed-off-by: Graham Hayes <gr@ham.ie>
'}]
commit_message:
DNM: Fix DNS Recordset CRUD to use IDs

This is checking if I60d6400631f31cba89a6d07382c380006bd2ded2
fixes the broken test.

If a zone name is supplied to a recordset function
we should lookup the ID to use that in the URL,
as the name in the URL will return a 404.

Also harmonised the naming of vars in the recordset
section to make this clearer.

Change-Id: I60d6400631f31cba89a6d07382c380006bd2ded3
Signed-off-by: Graham Hayes <gr@ham.ie>

commit_message:
Have zuul check out ansible for devel AIO job

Zuul is configured to understand ansible/ansible on github. Add ansible
as a required-project for the devel job so that depends-on patches will
work. Once we're happy with this, we can add the devel-aio job to be run
on PRs to os_ modules.

Change-Id: I12a74d97593c8780047d3dae9590f4e1fde3859b
(cherry picked from commit 148cc97d61b74b73cca8c799250f053c23ec853e)

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 25172, 'date': '2017-03-02 02:32:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Sorry for the late reply.
Using _get_or_create_network was resulting in all concurrent
runners creating/updating/deleting ports on a single Neutron
network. This was problematic for two reasons.
First, a network in Neutron in any normal deployment does not
have that many concurrent ports create/update/deletes happening
on it at once because networks very rarely.
Second, ports_per_network in the result of "rally plugin show --name NeutronNetworks.create_and_list_ports ports_per_network" is number of ports for one network . many ports create happening on it at once is inconsistent with the description.
This adjusts the scenario to always create a network for each
test run.'}, {'account_id': 22960, 'date': '2017-03-02 03:44:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I appreciate your intention. But if context has created network, we should it firstly. Because the num of network created is limit. If we extend the num of network, it could resolve this problem. A good idea is:
step 1)use network of context firstly.
step 2)check network's status. If all networks have been used in test, then we should consider to create new network."}, {'account_id': 23435, 'date': '2017-07-11 05:46:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I appreciate your intention. But if context has created network, we
 > should it firstly. Because the num of network created is limit. If
 > we extend the num of network, it could resolve this problem. A good
 > idea is:
 > step 1)use network of context firstly.
 > step 2)check network's status. If all networks have been used in
 > test, then we should consider to create new network.

But how to check network's status? please look at https://github.com/openstack/rally/blob/master/rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/neutron/utils.py#L313
it is random to select network of context, if one of the networks have no more ports, though other have more ports, it still be error."}, {'account_id': 21528, 'date': '2017-07-13 10:43:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@zhangzhihui, it is complex, our scenario just validate the feature and benchmark them, so i think we do not need to do this complex process.'}, {'account_id': 23435, 'date': '2017-07-13 10:54:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

so you mean you agree with longling zhang , we should replace _get_or_create_network with create_network?'}, {'account_id': 21528, 'date': '2017-07-13 11:24:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

No. i prefer to use network context.'}, {'account_id': 23435, 'date': '2017-07-13 11:50:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> No. i prefer to use network context.
please read my comment carefully.
"it is random to select network of context, if one of the networks have no more ports, though other have more ports, it still be error"

how to solve this problem?'}, {'account_id': 21528, 'date': '2017-07-13 12:42:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Could we calculate the ports count by ports_per_network and runner times ? If overflowing, we return the test.'}, {'account_id': 23435, 'date': '2017-07-17 01:55:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Could we calculate the ports count by ports_per_network and runner
 > times ? If overflowing, we return the test.

 > Could we calculate the ports count by ports_per_network and runner
 > times ? If overflowing, we return the test.

i don't know how to do, it is random to select network of context, if one of the networks have no more ports, but code still select it, test still be error, though other network of context have more ports."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 02:50:12.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

* Verified-1 by Jenkins (3)
'}, {'account_id': 25653, 'date': '2018-04-12 12:27:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

hi, longling zhang I think this patch is needed. Recently, I am testing these test cases. Can I finish this patch?'}, {'account_id': 25653, 'date': '2018-04-12 12:49:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Fix pep8 new warnings

A recent change in pep/pycodingchecks introduced new warnings as part of
the pep8 target that causes pep8 to fail now.

This patch fixes code that issued warnings W503,E731,E266,E402

In addition, old tests which were not ran anyway, and are no longer relevant (test_firewall)
were deleted.

Change-Id: Ic784775535547160a0dc0af5d5debfbb1833c6ba

commit_message:
devstack: use neutron-bagpipe-* for service names

Using a neutron-something name will enable smart log
display in the CI, which is more than a merely cosmetic
advantage.

Backward compatibility with setups using 'b-bgp' in
local.conf is ensured.

Change-Id: Ie87840816760a8404b341faf45beb99653e27f0e

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-10 23:55:38.000000000', 'message': 'Remove pycodestyle version pin. Add E402 and W503 to ignore.

Rather than pinning pycodestyle, ignore the E402 and W503 error. Fix
issue with E731 (Do not assign a lambda expression, use a def).

W503 is something we will likely never enable as it is a personal
style decision and can change depending on the code. There is no one
right answer. Interestingly there is also a W504 which is the opposite
check.

E402 is one we should most likely fix. But it can be done in a follow
patch or patches.

List of various error codes:
https://pycodestyle.readthedocs.io/en/latest/intro.html#error-codes

Change-Id: Ie2c31a8a3c75beeef22453cab5878cf0094bdf3f
'}]
commit_message:
Remove pycodestyle version pin. Add E402 and W503 to ignore.

Rather than pinning pycodestyle, ignore the E402 and W503 error. Fix
issue with E731 (Do not assign a lambda expression, use a def).

W503 is something we will likely never enable as it is a personal
style decision and can change depending on the code. There is no one
right answer. Interestingly there is also a W504 which is the opposite
check.

E402 is one we should most likely fix. But it can be done in a follow
patch or patches.

List of various error codes:
https://pycodestyle.readthedocs.io/en/latest/intro.html#error-codes

Change-Id: Ie2c31a8a3c75beeef22453cab5878cf0094bdf3f

commit_message:
Remove tox_install.sh helper

With the move to Zuul v3 there is no need to use zuul cloner anymore and
therefore also no need to have tox_install.sh -that does not work well
with the OpenStack CI.

This patch removes the need for the helpers, adapts tox.ini to install
with pip and moves to use packages from PyPi while installing from git
the only package (ceilometer) that does not publish in PyPi.

Change-Id: I955c9d737864b8a2557366be518922e192f4be91

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-11 12:18:55.000000000', 'message': "Break schedule_unhosted_gateways() into multiple DB transactions

When we're scheduling multiple gateway ports using the Least Loaded
policy (default), we need to take into account the actual load of
all chassis after each port is scheduled. Prior to this patch, the
scheduling happened under the same DB transaction so it will result
in scheduling all ports in the chassis which was less loaded by the time
the function was called, resulting in a very likely unbalanced state of
the gateway nodes.

NOTE: I'm working on bug 1762694 which will introduce functional
tests exercising this part.

Change-Id: I4404b0958d5a835a5ec449a6ff6696d6de6c78ef
Closes-Bug: 1763005
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-04-11 15:03:05.000000000', 'message': "Break schedule_unhosted_gateways() into multiple DB transactions

When we're scheduling multiple gateway ports using the Least Loaded
policy (default), we need to take into account the actual load of
all chassis after each port is scheduled. Prior to this patch, the
scheduling happened under the same DB transaction so it will result
in scheduling all ports in the chassis which was less loaded by the time
the function was called, resulting in a very likely unbalanced state of
the gateway nodes.

NOTE: I'm working on bug 1762694 which will introduce functional
tests exercising this part.

Change-Id: I4404b0958d5a835a5ec449a6ff6696d6de6c78ef
Closes-Bug: 1763005
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Break schedule_unhosted_gateways() into multiple DB transactions

When we're scheduling multiple gateway ports using the Least Loaded
policy (default), we need to take into account the actual load of
all chassis after each port is scheduled. Prior to this patch, the
scheduling happened under the same DB transaction so it will result
in scheduling all ports in the chassis which was less loaded by the time
the function was called, resulting in a very likely unbalanced state of
the gateway nodes.

NOTE: I'm working on bug 1762694 which will introduce functional
tests exercising this part.

Change-Id: I4404b0958d5a835a5ec449a6ff6696d6de6c78ef
Closes-Bug: 1763005
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Support quotas

Ensure that get_l2_gateway_connections_count is added to support
quotas. A change in horizon/neutron calls this method and
if its not an admin tenant then this fails. This results in a
tenant being unable to create a FIP when using horizon.

Closes-bug: #1762414

Change-Id: I8875334fa6700c33154bc690ebcad6cb5fe6c0c2
(cherry picked from commit ff8ff91e25b71a3453039731fcee57397ca3be10)

messages:
[{'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2018-02-23 14:28:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-02-23 15:24:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Grepping the code for influxdb, I see that telegraf and grafana both access it. Telegraf writes out a URL for each influx instance, and grafana just references api_interface_address, which assumes it is colocated with influx. Should those services be using HAProxy?'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2018-02-23 15:57:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2018-02-23 16:09:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Good spot. I think it should be safe to use the VIP for the Grafana datasource. Grafana is behind HAProxy and the config is stored in the DB.

As for telegraf, I'm reluctant to update that. The commit message relating to that code is a bit confusing, but I think the idea is
that an instance of telegraf should monitor the instance of InfluxDB
on the same host, so we wouldn't want it going via HAProxy. The instances of InfluxDB in this case would be standalone and not in a cluster. It doesn't consider HA mode."}, {'account_id': 16984, 'date': '2018-02-23 18:40:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 26556, 'date': '2018-02-24 01:26:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 24759, 'date': '2018-02-24 09:12:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-03-21 08:27:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

commit_message:
Support accessing InfluxDB via HAProxy

This change allows access to InfluxDB via HAProxy on the internal
network.

If HA is required the Enterprise version of InfluxDB will need to
be installed. This could be implemented by customising the InfluxDB
Docker file.

There are other alternatives to HA, such as the InfluxDB Relay [1].
Support for this is considered to be outside of the scope of this
bugfix.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/performance-docs/
    methodologies/monitoring/influxha.html

Closes-Bug: #1751283
Change-Id: I4624efbd99c0cddd1361f2438866ad3a82e5557b

subject: Fix ipc_mode comparison in the latest docker
messages: [{'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2018-04-10 02:08:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2018-04-10 02:09:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 22165, 'date': '2018-04-10 03:37:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-04-12 10:57:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-10 02:08:52.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ipc_mode comparison in the latest docker

In old docker, if you do not specify ipc_mode, the default value is empty,
but in the latest docker, such as 17.09.0, if not specified, the default
is "IpcMode": "shareable", which will cause all containers to be deleted
and re-create when to redeploy or upgrade. This commit solves the
problem.

Change-Id: Ia8269b9c8066880e4aee23d6fdea8d9c04c41e44
Closes-Bug: #1747586
(cherry picked from commit 193ce726c242556416556869ed48c86e14b22632)
'}, {'created': '2018-04-10 02:09:27.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ipc_mode comparison in the latest docker

In old docker, if you do not specify ipc_mode, the default value is empty,
but in the latest docker, such as 17.09.0, if not specified, the default
is "IpcMode": "shareable", which will cause all containers to be deleted
and re-create when to redeploy or upgrade. This commit solves the
problem.

Change-Id: Ia8269b9c8066880e4aee23d6fdea8d9c04c41e44
Closes-Bug: #1747586
(cherry picked from commit 193ce726c242556416556869ed48c86e14b22632)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ipc_mode comparison in the latest docker

In old docker, if you do not specify ipc_mode, the default value is empty,
but in the latest docker, such as 17.09.0, if not specified, the default
is "IpcMode": "shareable", which will cause all containers to be deleted
and re-create when to redeploy or upgrade. This commit solves the
problem.

Change-Id: Ia8269b9c8066880e4aee23d6fdea8d9c04c41e44
Closes-Bug: #1747586
(cherry picked from commit 193ce726c242556416556869ed48c86e14b22632)

commit_message:
Fix ipc_mode comparison in the latest docker

In old docker, if you do not specify ipc_mode, the default value is empty,
but in the latest docker, such as 17.09.0, if not specified, the default
is "IpcMode": "shareable", which will cause all containers to be deleted
and re-create when to redeploy or upgrade. This commit solves the
problem.

Change-Id: Ia8269b9c8066880e4aee23d6fdea8d9c04c41e44
Closes-Bug: #1747586
(cherry picked from commit 193ce726c242556416556869ed48c86e14b22632)

commit_message:
suppress E402,E501,W503 hacking checks

A recent change in pep/pycodingchecks introduced new warnings as part of
the pep8 target that causes pep8 to fail now.

This patch adds E402,E501,W503 to our ignore hacking checks until
we have time to look into them and address. These will be done in
master and not stable.

Also see: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560065/

Change-Id: I57635bdfb776c06674a41cef8e3de36599ed8332

commit_message:
Force json output for openstack software deployment show <deployment>

By default the output is a table, if we use jq this needs to be
a json object.

Closes-Bug: 1763073

Change-Id: Ifc2829a14229d61cf0da0e6dd6dc1ea873475bb9

commit_message:
Fix typo in ovn_cms_options config

ovn-cms-options config option is mistakenly added as ovn-cms-opts.
As a result ovn_cms_options is never set in SBDB and OVN
mechanism driver is unable to schedule router as expected.

Change-Id: Iaa89a1dbec732c3aa743fa3f5cf1f4931e2ab9ef

 > l2-gateway, or something that is "normal" way of happenning things.

Hey! again you are right :-)

[root@devstack networking-l2gw]# journalctl -f -u devstack@q-svc | grep Duplicate                                                                                                                             
Nov 21 09:52:28 devstack neutron-server[893]: 2017-11-21 09:52:28.216 893 WARNING neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.type_tunnel [req-2ee5c5c2-75ef-43a7-b473-9baa8671c7f6 - -] Endpoint with ip 192.168.0.13 already exists: DBDuplicateEntry: (pymysql.err.IntegrityError) (1062, u"Duplicate entry '192.168.0.13' for key 'PRIMARY'") [SQL: u'INSERT INTO ml2_vxlan_endpoints (ip_address, udp_port, host) VALUES (%(ip_address)s, %(udp_port)s, %(host)s)'] [parameters: {'host': None, 'ip_address': u'192.168.0.13', 'udp_port': 4789}]
Nov 21 09:52:28 devstack neutron-server[893]: 2017-11-21 09:52:28.285 893 WARNING neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.type_tunnel [req-2ee5c5c2-75ef-43a7-b473-9baa8671c7f6 - -] Endpoint with ip 192.168.0.13 already exists: DBDuplicateEntry: (pymysql.err.IntegrityError) (1062, u"Duplicate entry '192.168.0.13' for key 'PRIMARY'") [SQL: u'INSERT INTO ml2_vxlan_endpoints (ip_address, udp_port, host) VALUES (%(ip_address)s, %(udp_port)s, %(host)s)'] [parameters: {'host': None, 'ip_address': u'192.168.0.13', 'udp_port': 4789}]
Nov 21 09:52:28 devstack neutron-server[893]: 2017-11-21 09:52:28.372 893 WARNING neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.type_tunnel [req-2ee5c5c2-75ef-43a7-b473-9baa8671c7f6 - -] Endpoint with ip 192.168.0.13 already exists: DBDuplicateEntry: (pymysql.err.IntegrityError) (1062, u"Duplicate entry '192.168.0.13' for key 'PRIMARY'") [SQL: u'INSERT INTO ml2_vxlan_endpoints (ip_address, udp_port, host) VALUES (%(ip_address)s, %(udp_port)s, %(host)s)'] [parameters: {'host': None, 'ip_address': u'192.168.0.13', 'udp_port': 4789}]
Nov 21 09:52:29 devstack neutron-server[893]: 2017-11-21 09:52:29.906 893 WARNING neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.type_tunnel [req-6ffb2b7c-3448-48cb-a845-54070f0fd94d - -] Endpoint with ip 192.168.0.13 already exists: DBDuplicateEntry: (pymysql.err.IntegrityError) (1062, u"Duplicate entry '192.168.0.13' for key 'PRIMARY'") [SQL: u'INSERT INTO ml2_vxlan_endpoints (ip_address, udp_port, host) VALUES (%(ip_address)s, %(udp_port)s, %(host)s)'] [parameters: {'host': None, 'ip_address': u'192.168.0.13', 'udp_port': 4789}]


I think it's the same bug causing "duplicated entry" messages and out-of-sync database. And it's because the agent calls are done outside the db transactions.'}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2017-11-21 09:54:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2017-11-21 10:05:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Hi Ricardo, I test with l2gw-agent, no ODL or other fancy things.
I send the logs in mail'}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2017-11-21 17:43:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2017-11-21 17:43:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2017-11-22 16:48:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2017-11-22 16:54:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2017-11-27 10:49:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2017-11-27 10:50:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2017-11-28 11:44:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Patch Set 12 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2017-11-28 13:52:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Workflow-1

I looked the code for 2 weeks to find a way to update /remove ports, and get only half working solutions :-)'}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2017-12-04 10:02:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 21747, 'date': '2017-12-04 12:23:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 27218, 'date': '2017-12-04 12:24:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2017-12-04 14:19:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

L2GW driver has two ways of use, the segmentation id can be included during creation/update of the gateway:

neutron l2-gateway-update gw1 --device name=hwvtep,interface_names="eth1|400;eth2"
 neutron l2-gateway-connection-create gw1 private

or during connection creation:

neutron l2-gateway-update gw1 --device name=hwvtep,interface_names="eth1;eth2"
 neutron l2-gateway-connection-create gw1 private --default-segmentation-id 200


During update, we should do the following check. If there are existing connections, and the update call carries the seg_id...raise an exception.'}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2017-12-04 15:25:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2017-12-04 15:32:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 18.'}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2017-12-04 15:39:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 19.'}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2017-12-04 15:54:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20.'}, {'account_id': 21747, 'date': '2017-12-05 07:42:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 21.'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2017-12-05 09:39:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2017-12-05 09:42:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2017-12-05 12:18:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 21:

commit_message:
Enable L2GW Update with existing connections

  This patch implements the update when there are
  existing connections. It allows the user to add
  or remove interfaces and the existing connections
  will be propagated to the new interfaces.

Change-Id: Ic18e138cc1fb328258d6520250e4e47f9d566ca3
Signed-off-by: Ricardo Noriega <rnoriega@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Peng Liu <pliu@redhat.com>

subject: Services: update service's status after LB completely provisioned.

[{'created': '2018-04-06 06:46:19.000000000', 'message': "Services: update service's status after LB completely provisioned.

When creating a service of type 'LoadBalancer', you create
a cloud network load balancer.
This provides an externally-accessible IP address that sends
traffic to the correct port on your cluster nodes.
The external IP address is stored in k8s service's status
information (under loadbalancer/ingress/ip).

Kuryr implements this capability using OpenStack floating IP
functionality.
This patch updates Kuryr to store external IP information only after
LB was entirely configured in OpenStack.

Change-Id: I1d43f03d49d6e760c859f219aa9a4c209087c753
Closes-Bug: 1756730
(cherry picked from commit e0dfd36e36887b7d56ff762e86741f1a6cb5e161)
"}]
commit_message:
Services: update service's status after LB completely provisioned.

When creating a service of type 'LoadBalancer', you create
a cloud network load balancer.
This provides an externally-accessible IP address that sends
traffic to the correct port on your cluster nodes.
The external IP address is stored in k8s service's status
information (under loadbalancer/ingress/ip).

Kuryr implements this capability using OpenStack floating IP
functionality.
This patch updates Kuryr to store external IP information only after
LB was entirely configured in OpenStack.

Change-Id: I1d43f03d49d6e760c859f219aa9a4c209087c753
Closes-Bug: 1756730
(cherry picked from commit e0dfd36e36887b7d56ff762e86741f1a6cb5e161)

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I192ab9b96391be24eb0b51240fd6ddc9434b4283
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Use argparse to parse command line options

This patch introduces argparse to storlet daemon and daemon factory,
where we previously had very easy arg parsing implementation, to show
more efficient help information about command line options for
the process.

Change-Id: I8c93fb0b5e8a9f32906ee5d7e794e6ee4dac0af0
