This means everything is serialized to a string by default, which seems to be a like a bad idea leading to programming error being unoticed.'}, {'account_id': 20864, 'date': '2016-05-31 08:09:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 18152, 'date': '2016-05-31 08:14:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 18152, 'date': '2016-05-31 08:22:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> This means everything is serialized to a string by default, which
 > seems to be a like a bad idea leading to programming error being
 > unoticed.

I see your point, but in the case of logging there is no way to know what kind of objects will be given to dumps, so it's not really possible to explicitly process every anticipated object type.

I could simply introduce the serialize function (which should never raise an exception) but not use it by default, and then patch oslo.log to use it explicitly. What do you think?"}, {'account_id': 20864, 'date': '2016-05-31 08:24:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-05-31 08:35:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified-1

Build failed (check pipeline).  For information on how to proceed, see http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#automated-testing

- gate-oslo.serialization-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/00/322900/3/check/gate-oslo.serialization-docs/0fe681c//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 2m 09s
- gate-oslo.serialization-pep8 http://logs.openstack.org/00/322900/3/check/gate-oslo.serialization-pep8/cb780e4/ : FAILURE in 1m 24s
- gate-oslo.serialization-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/00/322900/3/check/gate-oslo.serialization-python27/03504cf/ : SUCCESS in 2m 22s
- gate-oslo.serialization-python34 http://logs.openstack.org/00/322900/3/check/gate-oslo.serialization-python34/7c7d282/ : SUCCESS in 2m 08s
- gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-oslo.serialization http://logs.openstack.org/00/322900/3/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-oslo.serialization/4892e57/ : FAILURE in 47m 49s
- gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-oslo.serialization-mitaka http://logs.openstack.org/00/322900/3/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-oslo.serialization-mitaka/107d228/ : FAILURE in 49m 58s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 18152, 'date': '2016-05-31 13:55:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 18152, 'date': '2016-05-31 14:00:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

In the end I went a different route. I decided to leave to_primitive alone, because a lot of callers seem to rely on the fact that it returns the object unchanged if it is not recognized.

So I created the serialize function, which is essentially the same as to_primitive except that it turns unknown objects into strings.

It can be passed as an argument to jsonutils.dumps in oslo_log.formatters.JSONFormatter to solve the circular reference issue that occurs when logging in JSON.'}, {'account_id': 18152, 'date': '2016-05-31 14:05:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-05-31 15:13:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified-1

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 9796, 'date': '2017-04-28 06:20:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

seems this is related with Bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.serialization/+bug/1593641'}, {'account_id': 9107, 'date': '2017-09-14 08:18:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Julien Danjou: "This means everything is serialized to a string by default, which seems to be a like a bad idea leading to programming error being unoticed."

I proposed a different change adding an optional fallback parameter to to_primitive(): Ie0f7f2d09355c3d2a9f7c5ee8f7e02dfea3b073b.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 02:19:24.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

* Verified-1 by Jenkins (3)
'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-04-11 18:14:29.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This has been in merge conflict for nearly two years, and it seems the problem it was addressing has been fixed in a different way.  Please feel free to restore it if you do still want to make this change though.'}, {'account_id': 9107, 'date': '2018-04-12 09:52:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

" This commit introduces the serialize function, which calls to_primitive to serialize objects, but returns a string representation of the object whenever to_primitive doesn't know how to serialize it."

FYI in the meanwhile, I added a "fallback" parameter to to_primitive() which allows to decide how serialize objects which failed to be serialized automatically. to_primitive(obj, fallback=six.text_type) is more or less the same than the proposed serialize(obj) function.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2016-05-30 15:52:18.000000000', 'message': 'jsonutils: avoid circular reference in JSON formatter

The to_primitive function is called recursively, but in certain cases it
returns the same value as it received, leading to an infinite recursion
eventually broken by a "ValueError: Circular reference detected."

It causes stack traces when oslo_log.formatters.JSONFormatter is
selected as the log formatter for various OpenStack daemons.

This commit turns the value passed to to_primitive into a string if all
other serializtion attempts have failed.

Change-Id: Iaf27aad2680255a51360800e5b1aecd53ec89bfd
'}, {'created': '2016-05-30 15:57:27.000000000', 'message': 'jsonutils: avoid circular reference in JSON formatter

The to_primitive function is called recursively, but in certain cases
it returns the same value as it received, leading to an infinite
recursion eventually broken by a "ValueError: Circular reference
detected."

It causes stack traces when oslo_log.formatters.JSONFormatter is
selected as the log formatter for various OpenStack daemons.

This commit turns the value passed to to_primitive into a string if
all other serialization attempts have failed.

Change-Id: Iaf27aad2680255a51360800e5b1aecd53ec89bfd
'}, {'created': '2016-05-31 07:45:04.000000000', 'message': 'jsonutils: avoid circular reference in JSON formatter

The to_primitive function is called recursively, but in certain cases
it returns the same value as it received, leading to an infinite
recursion eventually broken by a "ValueError: Circular reference
detected."

It causes stack traces when oslo_log.formatters.JSONFormatter is
selected as the log formatter for various OpenStack daemons.

This commit introduces the _serialize function, which is a simplified
version of to_primitive that returns a string when it doesn't know
what to do with a given object, and makes dump, dumps and
dump_as_bytes use it by default.

Change-Id: Iaf27aad2680255a51360800e5b1aecd53ec89bfd
'}, {'created': '2016-05-31 13:55:57.000000000', 'message': 'jsonutils: add a serialize function

The to_primitive function is called recursively, but in certain cases
it returns the same value as it received, leading to an infinite
recursion eventually broken by a "ValueError: Circular reference
detected."

It causes stack traces when oslo_log.formatters.JSONFormatter is
selected as the log formatter for various OpenStack daemons.

This commit introduces the serialize function, which calls
to_primitive to serialize objects, but returns a string representation
of the object whenever to_primitive doesn't know how to serialize it.

It is intended for use as the "default" argument of jsonutils.dumps in
oslo.log, which would fix the stack traces in
oslo_log.formatters.JSONFormatter.

Change-Id: Iaf27aad2680255a51360800e5b1aecd53ec89bfd

It is intended for use as the "default" argument of jsonutils.dumps in

detected."

It causes stack traces when oslo_log.formatters.JSONFormatter is
selected as the log formatter for various OpenStack daemons.

This commit introduces the serialize function, which calls
to_primitive to serialize objects, but returns a string representation

It is intended for use as the "default" argument of jsonutils.dumps in

Change-Id: Iaf27aad2680255a51360800e5b1aecd53ec89bfd
'}]
commit_message:
jsonutils: add a serialize function

The to_primitive function is called recursively, but in certain cases
it returns the same value as it received, leading to an infinite
recursion eventually broken by a "ValueError: Circular reference
detected."

It causes stack traces when oslo_log.formatters.JSONFormatter is
selected as the log formatter for various OpenStack daemons.

This commit introduces the serialize function, which calls
to_primitive to serialize objects, but returns a string representation
of the object whenever to_primitive doesn't know how to serialize it.

It is intended for use as the "default" argument of jsonutils.dumps in
oslo.log, which would fix the stack traces in
oslo_log.formatters.JSONFormatter.

Change-Id: Iaf27aad2680255a51360800e5b1aecd53ec89bfd

commit_message:
Set mds "allow *" for admin

Error occurred after executing "ceph fs status" command, even if
deployment finished successfully becasue of rack of caps for mds.

We need to make it "allow *" for admin not "allow ".

please see this related with this bug:
https://github.com/ceph/ceph/commit/c7e905e7e232a973abf7c6fa71a2ffbad7aa0ffd
Closes-bug: #1763311

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-15 12:03:14.000000000', 'message': "Remove too large configdrive for handling error

When configdrive is too large, a node object cannot be saved to DB. If
it happens, the node cannot moved to DEPLOYFAIL because saving the node
is prevented again by the large configdrive in the object. In this
case, the node gets stuck in DEPLOYING, which doesn't allow any state
transition.

This patch removes the configdrive from a node object when storing the
configdrive fails. This also catches ConfigInvalid exception, which is
mentioned in the docsting, and any unexpected exception from
_store_configdrive() to avoid getting a node stuck in DEPLOYING.

Change-Id: I83cf3e02622fc3ed8f5b5389f533e374c1b985f3
Closes-Bug: 1745630
(cherry picked from commit 927c487a0f822ab789f38be5f895fe061e5e71cb)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove too large configdrive for handling error

When configdrive is too large, a node object cannot be saved to DB. If
it happens, the node cannot moved to DEPLOYFAIL because saving the node
is prevented again by the large configdrive in the object. In this
case, the node gets stuck in DEPLOYING, which doesn't allow any state
transition.

This patch removes the configdrive from a node object when storing the
configdrive fails. This also catches ConfigInvalid exception, which is
mentioned in the docsting, and any unexpected exception from
_store_configdrive() to avoid getting a node stuck in DEPLOYING.

Change-Id: I83cf3e02622fc3ed8f5b5389f533e374c1b985f3
Closes-Bug: 1745630
(cherry picked from commit 927c487a0f822ab789f38be5f895fe061e5e71cb)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-10 23:49:38.000000000', 'message': 'Improve check for O_TMPFILE support in unit tests

On Python < 3.4, there is no os.O_TMPFILE, so the check for O_TMPFILE
support was always reporting no-support. We now use utils.O_TMPFILE,
which is always defined.

Also, when opening an anonymous tempfile, you must open the directory
(not a file in the directory) with three flags or-ed together:
O_DIRECTORY, O_WRONLY, and O_TMPFILE. Calling open() with a subset of
those flags will receive either EISDIR or EINVAL. The check was trying
to open a file in the temp dir, so was always reporting no-support for
O_TMPFILE. We now correctly open the tempdir.

Change-Id: Iaf48ad9aecea73df4e794818dd15070360bff19f
'}]
commit_message:
Improve check for O_TMPFILE support in unit tests

On Python < 3.4, there is no os.O_TMPFILE, so the check for O_TMPFILE
support was always reporting no-support. We now use utils.O_TMPFILE,
which is always defined.

Also, when opening an anonymous tempfile, you must open the directory
(not a file in the directory) with three flags or-ed together:
O_DIRECTORY, O_WRONLY, and O_TMPFILE. Calling open() with a subset of
those flags will receive either EISDIR or EINVAL. The check was trying
to open a file in the temp dir, so was always reporting no-support for
O_TMPFILE. We now correctly open the tempdir.

Change-Id: Iaf48ad9aecea73df4e794818dd15070360bff19f

subject: Charm-helpers sync to fix CA cert comparison
messages: [{'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2018-04-11 21:21:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2018-04-12 08:09:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2\n\nLGTM'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-11 21:21:30.000000000', 'message': 'Charm-helpers sync to fix CA cert comparison

The comparison of bytes vs string of the CA certificate produces a
false negative. This leads to rewriting certificates and affecting
connectivity to services.

Read in the certificate as bytes as well for a bytes vs bytes
comparison.

Change-Id: Ie591ab8c958b59ef190a2f255eee8db0338d5ee3
Closes-Bug: #1762431
'}]
commit_message:
Charm-helpers sync to fix CA cert comparison

The comparison of bytes vs string of the CA certificate produces a
false negative. This leads to rewriting certificates and affecting
connectivity to services.

Read in the certificate as bytes as well for a bytes vs bytes
comparison.

Change-Id: Ie591ab8c958b59ef190a2f255eee8db0338d5ee3
Closes-Bug: #1762431

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-02 14:08:29.000000000', 'message': 'Register auth conf options for Placement

Placementclient uses keystoneauth1.loader to create a session towards
placement.
The actual calls to have a session are something like this:
* ks_loader.load_auth_from_conf_options() which is actually a call to
keystoneauth.loading.conf.load_from_conf_options() (see:
https://github.com/openstack/keystoneauth/blob/master/keystoneauth1/
loading/__init__.py#L28
* ks_loader.load_session_from_conf_options()
This can cause auth errors (TODO: get exact exception), by
https://github.com/openstack/keystoneauth/blob/master/keystoneauth1/
loading/conf.py#L103 registering first the base auth options are
preferred.

This patch call register_auth_conf_options() before loading them as the
above comment suggests.
As an extra to make the reading/maintaining easier the patch change the
import keystone to ks_loader and adds an constant for
PLACEMENT_CONF_SECTION.

Change-Id: Ibaa9ea5920c30a51b024582ff179df9cd01b26c5

commit_message:
Register auth conf options for Placement

Placementclient uses keystoneauth1.loader to create a session towards
placement.
The actual calls to have a session are something like this:
* ks_loader.load_auth_from_conf_options() which is actually a call to
keystoneauth.loading.conf.load_from_conf_options() (see:
https://github.com/openstack/keystoneauth/blob/master/keystoneauth1/
loading/__init__.py#L28
* ks_loader.load_session_from_conf_options()
This can cause auth errors (No authentication information found for
placement API), by https://github.com/openstack/keystoneauth/blob/
master/keystoneauth1/loading/conf.py#L103 registering first the
base auth options are preferred.

This patch call register_auth_conf_options() before loading them as the
above comment suggests.
As an extra to make the reading/maintaining easier the patch change the
import keystone to ks_loader and adds an constant for
PLACEMENT_CONF_SECTION.

Change-Id: Ibaa9ea5920c30a51b024582ff179df9cd01b26c5

subject: Charm-helpers sync to fix CA cert comparison
messages: [{'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2018-04-11 21:27:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2018-04-12 08:08:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2\n\nLGTM'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-11 21:27:15.000000000', 'message': 'Charm-helpers sync to fix CA cert comparison

The comparison of bytes vs string of the CA certificate produces a
false negative. This leads to rewriting certificates and affecting
connectivity to services.

Read in the certificate as bytes as well for a bytes vs bytes
comparison.

Closes-Bug: #1762431

Change-Id: Ie2348a83671b9636bd94227e903b1a50bff7aecc
'}]
commit_message:
Charm-helpers sync to fix CA cert comparison

The comparison of bytes vs string of the CA certificate produces a
false negative. This leads to rewriting certificates and affecting
connectivity to services.

Read in the certificate as bytes as well for a bytes vs bytes
comparison.

Closes-Bug: #1762431

Change-Id: Ie2348a83671b9636bd94227e903b1a50bff7aecc

@Sofer, we have a validation task that verifies that every single upgrade_task has its tags set and it's failing when blocking tasks together.

ERROR: upgrade task ({'when': 'octavia_health_enabled.rc == 0', 'block': [{'name': 'PreUpgrade step0,validation: Check service openstack-octavia-health-manager is running', 'command': 'systemctl is-active --quiet openstack-octavia-health-manager', 'tags': 'step0,validation'}, {'name': 'Stop and disable octavia_health_manager service', 'tags': 'step2', 'service': 'name=openstack-octavia-health-manager state=stopped enabled=no'}]}) is missing its tags keyword.

I agree, that is more readible, but similar patches have been submitted already without the block structure, so this one would be the only one with it. Are you ok with submitting this patch without the block and once Marios patch (removing tags) is submitted, I'll refactor in blocks all tasks sharing the same condition?"}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2017-11-24 10:19:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

commit_message:
Add validation task in docker services [Octavia]

Docker services are missing the pre-upgrade validation task
in the upgrade_tasks section which verifies if the service
is running before going on with the upgrade.

Change-Id: I72da8e027b6da654bda328d4540ec1e6ed9767ff
Partial-Bug: #1704389

subject: Charm-helpers sync to fix CA cert comparison
messages: [{'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2018-04-11 21:22:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2018-04-12 08:09:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2\n\nLGTM'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-11 21:22:41.000000000', 'message': 'Charm-helpers sync to fix CA cert comparison

The comparison of bytes vs string of the CA certificate produces a
false negative. This leads to rewriting certificates and affecting
connectivity to services.

Read in the certificate as bytes as well for a bytes vs bytes
comparison.

Closes-Bug: #1762431

Change-Id: I65f57573f0b24094b5db8b6854e26146e1b78455
'}]
commit_message:
Charm-helpers sync to fix CA cert comparison

The comparison of bytes vs string of the CA certificate produces a
false negative. This leads to rewriting certificates and affecting
connectivity to services.

Read in the certificate as bytes as well for a bytes vs bytes
comparison.

Closes-Bug: #1762431

Change-Id: I65f57573f0b24094b5db8b6854e26146e1b78455

Hi Kendall,

I have a general question on formatting the content. If I missed an earlier discussion about it plz point me to it. :)

Do the 'What is ...' sections need to be a note necessarily? It looks a little odd to me. I was wondering whether we could just say that as a reminder this is why you want to set these things up or maybe just add a link to further reads if someone doesn't know the tools and all this just as an intro paragraph and not a note.

Or if we want to keep the note block I think we can drop the 'What is ...' line from each of them.

And just a few more nits in line.

commit_message:
Add endpoint_type config option

Prior to their removal from the tempest repository, the heat tests
supported an endpoint_type option[1] to configure which endpoint
interface to use in its requests to the Orchestration service and other
OpenStack services. This patch adds back this support so that users can
configure the heat tests to run against non-public interfaces.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tempest/tree/tempest/config.py?h=17.2.0#n943

Change-Id: Id86f90e428136198b4244f12da5eb53f673fd788
(cherry picked from commit 30b1fd6903f8f7bf33ccefc12046e301b85bac9c)

subject: Charm-helpers sync to fix CA cert comparison
messages: [{'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2018-04-11 21:20:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2018-04-12 08:07:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2\n\nLGTM'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-11 21:20:04.000000000', 'message': 'Charm-helpers sync to fix CA cert comparison

The comparison of bytes vs string of the CA certificate produces a
false negative. This leads to rewriting certificates and affecting
connectivity to services.

Read in the certificate as bytes as well for a bytes vs bytes
comparison.

Closes-Bug: #1762431

Change-Id: Ic226149cc124ac5b84ab30d95a590f08489c67f2
'}]
commit_message:
Charm-helpers sync to fix CA cert comparison

The comparison of bytes vs string of the CA certificate produces a
false negative. This leads to rewriting certificates and affecting
connectivity to services.

Read in the certificate as bytes as well for a bytes vs bytes
comparison.

Closes-Bug: #1762431

Change-Id: Ic226149cc124ac5b84ab30d95a590f08489c67f2

subject: Tempest: Disable negative "quota is full" tests for port and subnet
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-04 09:49:24.000000000', 'message': 'Tempest: Disable test_create_port_when_quotas_is_full

This patch is disabling the "test_create_port_when_quotas_is_full"
tempest test from neutron-tempest-plugin.

When OVN metadata is enabled networking-ovn will create a metadata port
when a network is created. That will fulfill quota limit the set by that
test causing it to fail. Since tempest needs to be backend agnostic we
can't add any conditional based on the backend being OVN.

So, disabling that test until we can get it fixed here in
networking-ovn.

Change-Id: I0508b51642a29a00ea04433f6a30b2de4f79de80
Related-Bug: #1761119
'}, {'created': '2018-04-04 11:02:08.000000000', 'message': 'Tempest: Disable negative "quota is full" tests for port and subnet

This patch is disabling the "test_create_port_when_quotas_is_full"
and "test_create_subnet_from_pool_with_quota" tempest tests from
neutron-tempest-plugin.

When OVN metadata is enabled networking-ovn will create a metadata port
when a network is created. That will fulfill quota limit the set for the
port test, causing it to fail. The metadata port will also allocate an
IP address from the subnet, causing the subnet test to fail.

Since tempest needs to be backend agnostic we can't add any conditional
based on the backend being OVN. So, let's disable the tests until we
can get it fixed here in networking-ovn.

Change-Id: I0508b51642a29a00ea04433f6a30b2de4f79de80
Related-Bug: #1761119
'}]
commit_message:
Tempest: Disable negative "quota is full" tests for port and subnet

This patch is disabling the "test_create_port_when_quotas_is_full"
and "test_create_subnet_from_pool_with_quota" tempest tests from
neutron-tempest-plugin.

When OVN metadata is enabled networking-ovn will create a metadata port
when a network is created. That will fulfill quota limit the set for the
port test, causing it to fail. The metadata port will also allocate an
IP address from the subnet, causing the subnet test to fail.

Since tempest needs to be backend agnostic we can't add any conditional
based on the backend being OVN. So, let's disable the tests until we
can get it fixed here in networking-ovn.

Change-Id: I0508b51642a29a00ea04433f6a30b2de4f79de80
Related-Bug: #1761119

commit_message:
Don't redirect updates to shrinking shards

Now that a shrinking shard range's namespace is overlapped by the
acceptor shard range [1] there is no need to include shrinking shard
ranges when looking for a shard range to receive an object update. The
acceptor shard range is a better destination for the update.

[1] Related-Change: I47e4ee2123f617d6eb7fdfdce94d8de877a42e5c

Change-Id: I0a50902f7ef65b056f6f6e43dc8fd01cee5a9593

subject: Fix ContainerBroker.get_shard_ranges() sort order
messages:
[{'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-04-02 16:28:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-04-02 21:57:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-04-02 22:05:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

This moves the sort to python rather than sql, but it's only way I know to impose the ShardRange.MAX > everything rule, unless there is some sql magic I don't know."}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-04-03 16:22:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

probe tests flakey'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-04-04 11:43:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-04-04 19:11:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-04-12 08:08:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-02 16:28:36.000000000', 'message': "Fix ContainerBroker.get_shard_ranges() sort order

The SQL query used to select shard range rows from a container db
ordered the results by 'lower' and then 'upper'. However, an upper
value of ShardRange.MAX is stored in the db as the empty string, which
sorts before any other upper value. Consequently shard ranges might be
returned in unexpected order. For example, shard ranges with bounds
('', 'k') and ('', '') would be returned in order ('', '') and ('',
'k').

To ensure the correct ordering, the returned shard ranges are now
sorted after the db rows have been converted to ShardRange instances.

Change-Id: Ifca3362b12a2dfb12f05dd812a35878cabd80924
"}, {'created': '2018-04-02 21:57:13.000000000', 'message': "Fix ContainerBroker.get_shard_ranges() sort order

The SQL query used to select shard range rows from a container db
ordered the results by 'lower' and then 'upper'. However, an upper
value of ShardRange.MAX is stored in the db as the empty string, which
sorts before any other upper value. Consequently shard ranges might be
returned in unexpected order. For example, shard ranges with bounds
('', 'k') and ('', '') would be returned in order ('', '') and ('',
'k').

To ensure the correct ordering, the returned shard ranges are now
sorted after the db rows have been converted to ShardRange instances.

Change-Id: Ifca3362b12a2dfb12f05dd812a35878cabd80924
"}, {'created': '2018-04-04 11:43:29.000000000', 'message': "Fix ContainerBroker.get_shard_ranges() sort order

The SQL query used to select shard range rows from a container db
ordered the results by 'lower' and then 'upper'. However, an upper
value of ShardRange.MAX is stored in the db as the empty string, which
sorts before any other upper value. Consequently shard ranges might be
returned in unexpected order. For example, shard ranges with bounds
('', 'k') and ('', '') would be returned in order ('', '') and ('',
'k').

To ensure the correct ordering, the returned shard ranges are now
sorted after the db rows have been converted to ShardRange instances.

Change-Id: Ifca3362b12a2dfb12f05dd812a35878cabd80924
"}]
commit_message:
Fix ContainerBroker.get_shard_ranges() sort order

The SQL query used to select shard range rows from a container db
ordered the results by 'lower' and then 'upper'. However, an upper
value of ShardRange.MAX is stored in the db as the empty string, which
sorts before any other upper value. Consequently shard ranges might be
returned in unexpected order. For example, shard ranges with bounds
('', 'k') and ('', '') would be returned in order ('', '') and ('',
'k').

To ensure the correct ordering, the returned shard ranges are now
sorted after the db rows have been converted to ShardRange instances.

Change-Id: Ifca3362b12a2dfb12f05dd812a35878cabd80924

[{'created': '2018-04-11 09:03:07.000000000', 'message': 'Mount the public TLS certificate for HAProxy on up(date|grade) on pacemaker

As part of the minor update workflow and the update workflow, this changes
the pacemaker haproxy bundle resource to add the needed mount for public
TLS to work.

This also handles the reloading of the container to fetch any new certificates
and if needed, it will restart the pacemaker resource (for upgrades), since
we would need pacemaker to re-create the resource.

Change-Id: I850f4de17e7f7e3b46deb27119227ef76658dcb5

(cherry picked from commit 8b85faf7e66a49977f7fd18512e1534488ca4f07)
'}]
commit_message:
Mount the public TLS certificate for HAProxy on up(date|grade) on pacemaker

As part of the minor update workflow and the update workflow, this changes
the pacemaker haproxy bundle resource to add the needed mount for public
TLS to work.

This also handles the reloading of the container to fetch any new certificates
and if needed, it will restart the pacemaker resource (for upgrades), since
we would need pacemaker to re-create the resource.

Change-Id: I850f4de17e7f7e3b46deb27119227ef76658dcb5
Closes-Bug: #1759797
(cherry picked from commit 8b85faf7e66a49977f7fd18512e1534488ca4f07)

commit_message:
Fix tag searching

When python-mistralclient filters it passes a dictionary not just the
string. This clears the dictionary and fix the search parameters into
lists for multiple tags to be searched if separeted by commas
like:

openstack workflow list --filter tags=tripleo-common-managed,foo

Change-Id: Ie082901fd7eb8b61a6306da1275a79aeb6c4a6de
Closes-Bug: #1716648

commit_message:
build opensuse images from the openstack mirror

This avoids especially for Tumbleweed mismatches betweeen the
mirrored repository that is used for installing the additional
dependencies and the base image.

subject: Fix pep8 errors
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-12 04:56:13.000000000', 'message': 'Fix pep8 errors

Recent pep8 upgrade and corresponding pycodestyle(2.4.0) update break
neutron-lbaas pep8 job due to the new rules.

This commit fixes the following new errors:
- E501 line too long
- E402 module level import not at top of file
- W503 line break before binary operator

Story: 2001828
Task: 12584

Change-Id: I7f728d6ca66248acdf6f5c504bcfdcc8c71446ad
'}]
commit_message:
Fix pep8 errors

Recent pep8 upgrade and corresponding pycodestyle(2.4.0) update break
neutron-lbaas pep8 job due to the new rules.

This commit fixes the following new errors:
- E501 line too long
- E402 module level import not at top of file
- W503 line break before binary operator

Story: 2001828
Task: 12584

Change-Id: I7f728d6ca66248acdf6f5c504bcfdcc8c71446ad

commit_message:
do not list setuptools as explicit dependency

Projects should not need to list setuptools as a dependency,
especially when they don't import it directly. The only use here seems
to be in setup.py, and setuptools must already be installed before
that is run anyway since setuptools is what runs it.

Change-Id: I573c3a5981e9f207811f5438c89e94d3c75e13f8
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

This change also removes the redundant entry for eventlet from
test-requirements.txt.

Change-Id: I810741a01614609f86cb792629a253d128029c80
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Fix call to model_query in sqlalchemy.api._get_collection

Fix `columns` parameter in call to `model_query` when
sqlalchemy.api._get_collection called with insecure to
true, and specific fields defined.

Change-Id: Ib46173d42d794775cfa302856cf9703ce8549389
Closes-Bug: #1763068

commit_message:
gerritbot: Announce stable branch changes of openstack/requirements

Have gerritbot announce stable branch changes of
openstack/requirements to the #openstack-requirements IRC channel,
like it does for 'master' branch changes.

commit_message:
unit test: unbreak test cases for callbacks.subscribe

patch set of [1] added callback priority so that a new argument, priority,
was added to subscribe method. Thus its signature was changed.
It caused to break some unit tests.[2] Those test cases check arguments passed
to subscribe method.

The fix to those test cases needs to be compatible with older version of
neutron-lib.
So add a helper method, get_subscribe_args, to produce argument to subscribe
by checking if neutron-lib supports callback priority or not. and apply it
to broken test cases.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/541766/
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/git.openstack.org/openstack/neutron/master/openstack-tox-py35-with-neutron-lib-master/66d328a/testr_results.html.gz
  test_capabilities.CapabilitiesTest.test_register
  test_ovs_capabilities.CapabilitiesTest.test_register
  test_backend.ServerSideRpcBackendTest.test___init__

Change-Id: I94066ff8a8dae5c5637478aa52883b3b451f2857

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-11 22:27:50.000000000', 'message': "[Pike only] Add pycodestyle to the linter blacklist

The 2.4.0 version of pycodestyle has enabled at least three checks
that weren't previously enabled:
 * E402: module level import not at top of file
 * E731: do not assign a lambda expression, use a def
 * W503: line break before binary operator

This is breaking projects like openstack/ironic. Without this patch
they can not pin the version of pycodestyle.

This patch is similar to commit
1a9a31d3611fa2d435a171acd6e77449adc3bb9c that landed in the Queens
release.

Change-Id: I136afc2ad1ed3dba6fd7ef48b5b3abc60c80009a
"}]
commit_message:
[Pike only] Add pycodestyle to the linter blacklist

The 2.4.0 version of pycodestyle has enabled at least three checks
that weren't previously enabled:
 * E402: module level import not at top of file
 * E731: do not assign a lambda expression, use a def
 * W503: line break before binary operator

This is breaking projects like openstack/ironic. Without this patch
they can not pin the version of pycodestyle.

This patch is similar to commit
1a9a31d3611fa2d435a171acd6e77449adc3bb9c that landed in the Queens
release.

Change-Id: I136afc2ad1ed3dba6fd7ef48b5b3abc60c80009a

commit_message:
add regression test for 1546396

'|' is not supported by some mysql release with out '\'
in front of it when using REGEX query, it can lead
to 500 error to API layer. So this is a regression test
to ensure this kind of error not occur again.

it depends on fix of original code to land

Related-Bug: 1546396

Change-Id: I62236c27624b0ca5d855a9046ab83622bc2d3d2e

messages: [{'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-11 19:13:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-04-11 19:15:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-04-11 20:09:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-04-11 20:10:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-04-12 03:27:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-11 19:13:12.000000000', 'message': 'skip virtualenv setup when there is already a virtualenv

Support local use more easily by skipping the installation step if it
looks like the user has already done that once manually. This makes
running the script multiple times much much faster.

Change-Id: Id2a139c9d68c2ebcee558cbc493b47167d2a2e1d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
skip virtualenv setup when there is already a virtualenv

Support local use more easily by skipping the installation step if it
looks like the user has already done that once manually. This makes
running the script multiple times much much faster.

Change-Id: Id2a139c9d68c2ebcee558cbc493b47167d2a2e1d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Unity: fail to detach lun when auto zone enabled

When the lun is the last one attached to the host and it is detached,
the attribute `host.host_luns` is None. Use `not` in if statement which
is pythonic in checking None and empty list of `host.host_luns`.

Change-Id: I5d8f63f9a78d001bc699af538f586aab8d73a5cf
Closes-bug: #1759175

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-11 14:45:09.000000000', 'message': "Fix race fail in test_resize_with_reschedule_then_live_migrate

The assertion in the test that the migration status is 'completed'
is flawed in that it assumes when the instance status is 'ACTIVE'
the migration is completed, which isn't True, since the instance
status gets changed before the migration is completed, but they are
very close in time so there is a race, which is how this test slipped
by. This fixes the issue by polling the migration status until it
is actually completed or we timeout.

Change-Id: I61f745667f4c003d7e3ca6f2f9a99194930ac892
Closes-Bug: #1762876
"}]
commit_message:
Fix race fail in test_resize_with_reschedule_then_live_migrate

The assertion in the test that the migration status is 'completed'
is flawed in that it assumes when the instance status is 'ACTIVE'
the migration is completed, which isn't True, since the instance
status gets changed before the migration is completed, but they are
very close in time so there is a race, which is how this test slipped
by. This fixes the issue by polling the migration status until it
is actually completed or we timeout.

Change-Id: I61f745667f4c003d7e3ca6f2f9a99194930ac892
Closes-Bug: #1762876

that is currently in project-config to castellan.
This is part of the zuulv3 migration process.

[{'created': '2018-04-10 18:17:13.000000000', 'message': 'Only a leader should set Scan-Done metadata

Before, if a leader found shard ranges and set Scan-Done to True and

Change-Id: Ie3f1a53902fcaf5439a316e941df90f2a1ae3eeb

commit_message:
Only a leader should set Scan-Done metadata

Before, if a leader found shard ranges and set Scan-Done to True and
then another node had its own shard range state set to sharding
*before* it received any other shard ranges, then the other node
would set Scan-Done to False. This would then prevent any sharding
progress on that node and any other node to which the Scan-Done
metadata was replicated.

Since a leader node is the only node that sets Scan-Done to True it
should also be the only node that sets it to False.

Change-Id: Ie3f1a53902fcaf5439a316e941df90f2a1ae3eeb

commit_message:
Move state alias resolution into ContainerBroker

...to better encapsulate the sets of states used for
listing and updating.

ContainerBroker.resolve_shard_range_states() is called from the
container server so that the server still has access to the
requested state numbers.

Change-Id: I464c0c29ad8094b80d02f843772421cedb4f5e6d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-03 20:53:46.000000000', 'message': "WIP Only redirect updates originating from the updater

TODO: test object PUT path update headers
      consider avoiding an redirect lookup for unsharded containers

The relatively costly task of looking for a shard range to which an
update might be redirected is now only performed when the update
originates from the object updater. This is inferred from the presence
of an 'X-Backend-Accept-Redirect' header.

Futhermore, the object updater only includes this header for updates
that do not already have a redirection location cached in the async
pending file/update data.

Consequently:
- updates from old updater daemons will not be redirected.
- updates in the client PUT/DELETE path will not be redirected *again*
  (they will normally have had their update target 'redirected' by the
  proxy en route to the object server).
- updates to a shard container will not be redirected because they will
  already have an update location from the root container.

When a container first moves to sharded state, there will be a short
period of time during which the proxy has not learnt that the
container is sharding and will not re-target the object update. These
updates will now land in the root misplaced objects table.

Change-Id: I3b0f500ca7082a3c96ed2fb72f13073a9c840773

commit_message:
Only redirect updates originating from the updater

To avoid opening a container database to handle every object update,
the container server now only looks for a shard range to which an
update might be redirected when the update originates from the object
updater. This is inferred from the presence of an
'X-Backend-Accept-Redirect' header.

Futhermore, the object updater only includes this header for updates
that do not already have a redirection location cached in the async
pending file/update data.

Consequently:
- updates from old updater daemons will not be redirected.
- updates in the client PUT/DELETE path will not be redirected *again*
  (they will normally have had their update target 'redirected' by the
  proxy en route to the object server).
- updates to a shard container will not be redirected because they will
  already have an update location from the root container.

When a container first moves to sharded state, there will be a short
period of time during which the proxy has not learnt that the
container is sharding and will not re-target the object update. These
updates will now land in the root misplaced objects table. Some
changes to probe tests are needed to account for this altered
behaviour.

Change-Id: I3b0f500ca7082a3c96ed2fb72f13073a9c840773

subject: override existing job config for networking-bigswitch
messages:
[{'account_id': 20751, 'date': '2018-04-12 01:01:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20751, 'date': '2018-04-12 01:06:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Clark, James,
Thanks for you inputs!
I’ve found the project template that has required-projects specified, which causes the incorrect branch selection (https://github.com/openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs/blob/5f6d861f4316a09965ad3b96acf386b67ee1efee/zuul.d/project-templates.yaml#L340-L366)
Do I override it as I’ve tried in this review request or create a new job variant in openstack-zuul-jobs and then use that in the template instead?
This review is just to get an idea about it. if this is the right way, then we can just go ahead and merge it :)

Thanks again for your help.'}, {'account_id': 20751, 'date': '2018-04-12 01:50:41.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

trying out this change with the in-project zuul job definition: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/556657/10/.zuul.yaml'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-12 01:01:09.000000000', 'message': 'override existing job config for networking-bigswitch

 - the current config has neutron in required-projects
 - if we do not override_checkout to specifiy the branch/tag to be
   checked out as newton-eol, it will checkout master, since
   stable/newton is not available anymore
 - to avoid this, we create a job variant within the project
   definition to override for stable/newton branch

Change-Id: Id1e74d428ca46e986fc496b11fa980310996de91
'}]
commit_message:
override existing job config for networking-bigswitch

 - the current config has neutron in required-projects
 - if we do not override_checkout to specifiy the branch/tag to be
   checked out as newton-eol, it will checkout master, since
   stable/newton is not available anymore
 - to avoid this, we create a job variant within the project
   definition to override for stable/newton branch

Change-Id: Id1e74d428ca46e986fc496b11fa980310996de91

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I329e6364d537f2acac796e389f15f3c7162a9244
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Allow abort live migrations in queued status
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 5754, 'name': 'Alex Xu', 'email': 'hejie.xu@intel.com', 'username': 'xuhj'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 7166, 'name': 'Sylvain Bauza', 'email': 'sbauza@redhat.com', 'username': 'sbauza'}, {'_account_id': 8768, 'name': 'Chris Friesen', 'email': 'chris.friesen@windriver.com', 'username': 'cbf123'}, {'_account_id': 8864, 'name': 'Artom Lifshitz', 'email': 'alifshit@redhat.com', 'username': 'artom'}, {'_account_id': 15888, 'name': 'Zhenyu Zheng', 'email': 'zheng.zhenyu@outlook.com', 'username': 'Kevin_Zheng'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2018-01-23 09:08:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 18020, 'date': '2018-01-23 09:17:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I can certainly see the benefit here, with this reasoning as well as timeouts along the scheduler process or a busy hypervisor which can leave a LM hung in the 'Queued' state for abnormal amounts of time. [{'created': '2018-01-23 09:08:24.000000000', 'message': 'Allow abort live migrations in queued status

The functionality of abort live migration was added in microversion 2.24,
and currently only migrations in ``running`` status are allowed to be
aborted.

While the number of live migration requests could be greater than the max
concurrent live migration configuration ``max_concurrent_live_migrations``,
and there will be migrations wait in queue. The migrations could remain in
``queued`` status for a very long time depend on the queue length and the
processing speed.

Admins may want to abort migrations in queue due to time consumption
considerations etc. It will be unreasonable to make admins wait until
the status turn to ``running`` before they can be aborted.

This spec adds support to allow abort live migrations in ``queued``
status.

commit_message:
Allow abort live migrations in queued status

The functionality of abort live migration was added in microversion 2.24,
and currently only migrations in ``running`` status are allowed to be
aborted.

While the number of live migration requests could be greater than the max
concurrent live migration configuration ``max_concurrent_live_migrations``,
and there will be migrations wait in queue. The migrations could remain in
``queued`` status for a very long time depend on the queue length and the
processing speed.

Admins may want to abort migrations in queue due to time consumption
considerations etc. It will be unreasonable to make admins wait until
the status turn to ``running`` before they can be aborted.

This spec adds support to allow abort live migrations in ``queued``
status.

APIImpact

Change-Id: I61881e2dc079412631c59a70567dd4e09eb257ca
Implement: blueprint abort-live-migration-in-queued-status

commit_message:
Update requirements

Address these issues in check-requirements:

Package u'setuptools' is used in requirements.txt but not in
lower-constraints.txt

Package u'sphinx' is constrained to 1.6.5 which does not match the
minimum version specifier 1.6.2 in test-requirements.txt

Change-Id: I7ef2c283f41f0576859338f546d95a50d365f0f3

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-09 15:42:58.000000000', 'message': 'Increase address allocation size for subnet pool tests with IPv4

This patch is increasing the address allocation size for the subnet pool
tests with IPv4 (SubnetPoolsTest class) by:

* Changing the min_prefixlen from 28 to 24
* Changing the subnet_cidr from /31 to /29

The reason for that is because some ML2 drivers such as OVN would create
a new port in Neutron at the moment that a network is created for being
used by the metadata agent. This new port will allocate an IP from the
subnet which was causing the tests below to fail with a "No more IP
addresses available on network ..." error:

SubnetPoolsTest.test_create_subnet_from_pool_with_prefixlen
SubnetPoolsTest.test_create_subnet_from_pool_with_quota
SubnetPoolsTest.test_create_subnet_from_pool_with_subnet_cidr

For more information see:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129084.html

Change-Id: If5098f6e60742421022712231589afe6755878dc
'}, {'created': '2018-04-10 08:50:34.000000000', 'message': 'Increase address allocation size for subnet pool tests with IPv4

This patch is increasing the address allocation size for the subnet pool
tests with IPv4 (SubnetPoolsTest class) by:

* Changing the subnet_cidr from /31 to /29
* Changing the max_prefixlen from 31 to 30

The reason for that is because some ML2 drivers such as OVN would create
a new port in Neutron at the moment that a network is created for being
used by the metadata agent. This new port will allocate an IP from the
subnet which was causing the tests below to fail with a "No more IP
addresses available on network ..." error:

SubnetPoolsTest.test_create_subnet_from_pool_with_prefixlen
SubnetPoolsTest.test_create_subnet_from_pool_with_quota
SubnetPoolsTest.test_create_subnet_from_pool_with_subnet_cidr

For more information see:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129084.html

Related-Bug: #1761119
Change-Id: If5098f6e60742421022712231589afe6755878dc
'}]
commit_message:
Increase address allocation size for subnet pool tests with IPv4

This patch is increasing the address allocation size for the subnet pool
tests with IPv4 (SubnetPoolsTest class) by:

* Changing the subnet_cidr from /31 to /29
* Changing the max_prefixlen from 31 to 30

The reason for that is because some ML2 drivers such as OVN would create
a new port in Neutron at the moment that a network is created for being
used by the metadata agent. This new port will allocate an IP from the
subnet which was causing the tests below to fail with a "No more IP
addresses available on network ..." error:

SubnetPoolsTest.test_create_subnet_from_pool_with_prefixlen
SubnetPoolsTest.test_create_subnet_from_pool_with_quota
SubnetPoolsTest.test_create_subnet_from_pool_with_subnet_cidr

For more information see:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129084.html

Related-Bug: #1761119
Change-Id: If5098f6e60742421022712231589afe6755878dc

commit_message:
Align enable_telemetry default with instack-undercloud

We've been trying to deprecate and remove these telemetry services
for some time, and Ic35bcf4f789a3f30e4634789e965203be74d2e8c
disabled them by default in instack-undercloud, so lets align the
t-q-e default with that value.

If users require the telemetry services, they can simply add the
undercloud_enable_telemetry: true option to their config.

Change-Id: I1f619d56eff4661820db3996dc826293c93869f6

commit_message:
Remove mox in tests/unit/test_utils.py

Replace mox with mock in nova/tests/unit/test_utils.py.
The 'test_supports_direct_io' method is
in the 'GetEndpointTestCase' class currently.
But it should be in an isolated test class.
So add the test class and move the method into it.

Then split the method into methods for each test case
to improve readability.

Change-Id: Id2350529b3322dfa8f7c13ac8e5f85aaf3041082
Implements: blueprint mox-removal
Closes-Bug: #1760017

[{'created': '2018-04-11 00:03:39.000000000', 'message': "Add ability to run specific tests in py35 tox environment.

This lets you run something like

    $ tox -e py35 -- -s test.unit.common.test_swob

and just run the swob tests. This is handy if you've got one or two
test failures to debug or if you're trying to get another test file
passing under Python 3.

Also removed the old py34 environment. Nothing uses it.

Change-Id: I244b8903ef0a445abd028004bf02d6c581a8afe2
"}]
commit_message:
Add ability to run specific tests in py35 tox environment.

This lets you run something like

    $ tox -e py35 -- -s test.unit.common.test_swob

and just run the swob tests. This is handy if you've got one or two
test failures to debug or if you're trying to get another test file
passing under Python 3.

Also removed the old py34 environment. Nothing uses it.

Change-Id: I244b8903ef0a445abd028004bf02d6c581a8afe2

commit_message:
Update image schema with Image API 2.6 statuses

Updates the schemas/image(s) responses and the api-ref.  (The dev
docs are correct.)  Adds a test so this won't happen again.

Closes-bug: #1762031

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Ief8bbf14effa1266c62c4600f889a18f1fdbde32
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Annotate all the filter parameters for networks
messages:
[{'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-03-19 22:19:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-03-22 13:26:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Is this still a work in progress? If so please -1W it.


A few overall comments:
- If we are going to add a new attr keyword, the IMO also need to update the api_attributes.rst doc to describe it.
- I think the base api attr test also should updated to check the is_filter value is a boolean.
- Needs a release note.
- If there's some processing that needs consideration for attributes is_filter, then neutron_lib.api.attributes also needs an update."}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-03-22 14:43:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-03-29 18:03:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-03-29 18:12:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Is this still a work in progress? If so please -1W it.
 > 
 > 
 > A few overall comments:
 > - If we are going to add a new attr keyword, the IMO also need to
 > update the api_attributes.rst doc to describe it.

Done

 > - I think the base api attr test also should updated to check the
 > is_filter value is a boolean.

It seems this is already addressed: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554369/2/neutron_lib/tests/unit/api/definitions/base.py@61

 > - Needs a release note.

Done

 > - If there's some processing that needs consideration for
 > attributes is_filter, then neutron_lib.api.attributes also needs an
 > update.

No processing is needed at neutron-lib. I expect this attribute to be used as an annotation and neutron server will read this attribute and do the corresponding processing."}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-03-29 18:13:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-04-04 18:40:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-04-04 21:48:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-04-05 12:35:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)

Does this (along with [1]) impl that decoupled plugin (projects) will need to update all their extensions if they have filterable attributes? If so do we know how much of an impact this is?


[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554368/'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-04-05 18:04:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-04-05 18:05:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-04-05 18:55:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Does this (along with [1]) impl that decoupled plugin (projects)
 > will need to update all their extensions if they have filterable
 > attributes? If so do we know how much of an impact this is?
 > 
 > 
 > [1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554368/

It is up to individual plugin to do that or not. It is not mandatory. In particular, what this patch does is just labeling all the attributes that have been confirmed as a valid filter [1]. It is simply adding metadata according to the API reference, so it shouldn't break anything. The proposal is to make the neutron core plugin to leverage these labels to do a better validation. Other plugin is suggested to follow but it is up to them.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/543623/"}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-04-05 19:10:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> > (1 comment)
 > >
 > > Does this (along with [1]) impl that decoupled plugin (projects)
 > > will need to update all their extensions if they have filterable
 > > attributes? If so do we know how much of an impact this is?
 > >
 > >
 > > [1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554368/
 > 
 > It is up to individual plugin to do that or not. It is not
 > mandatory. In particular, what this patch does is just labeling all
 > the attributes that have been confirmed as a valid filter [1]. It
 > is simply adding metadata according to the API reference, so it
 > shouldn't break anything. The proposal is to make the neutron core
 > plugin to leverage these labels to do a better validation. Other
 > plugin is suggested to follow but it is up to them.
 > 
 > [1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/543623/

If individual plugin decides to follow, they should show the API extension ``query-param-validation`` so that API users know that the validation is implemented. If some plugins decide not to follow, they can simply drop the API extension so that their API behavior is discoverable by users. Above all, I don't think there is too much impact on individual plugin."}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-04-06 12:23:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

I'm good with this.
However it seems like once the implementation lands we might send out an FYI note to the ML instructing other plugins if/how they can adopt this in their plugin."}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-04-06 20:41:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> I'm good with this.
 > However it seems like once the implementation lands we might send
 > out an FYI note to the ML instructing other plugins if/how they can
 > adopt this in their plugin.

Sure. I will do that."}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-04-07 20:46:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

I think that someone from drivers team should give +W on this patch maybe :)'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-04-07 20:51:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

Just a question: what about e.g. qos_policy id: https://github.com/openstack/neutron-lib/blob/master/neutron_lib/api/definitions/qos.py - can't it be used as filter parameter?"}, {'account_id': 27546, 'date': '2018-04-09 11:13:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-04-09 16:49:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> Just a question: what about e.g. qos_policy id: https://github.com/openstack/neutron-lib/blob/master/neutron_lib/api/definitions/qos.py
 > - can't it be used as filter parameter?

It seems this parameter cannot be used as a filter. I enabled the qos plugin and tried to filter the list of networks by policy ID but it looks neutron ignored this filter and returned the whole list.

  $ curl -g -X GET "http://10.0.0.15:9696/v2.0/networks?qos_policy_id=2e994cd9-dd32-490f-8c9a-1629cf7c8aa2" -H "Accept: application/json" -H "X-Auth-Token: $TOKEN"'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-04-09 17:05:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-04-09 17:05:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-04-10 10:24:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-04-11 20:09:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-04-11 21:03:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

> > Just a question: what about e.g. qos_policy id: https://github.com/openstack/neutron-lib/blob/master/neutron_lib/api/definitions/qos.py
 > > - can't it be used as filter parameter?
 > 
 > It seems this parameter cannot be used as a filter. I enabled the
 > qos plugin and tried to filter the list of networks by policy ID
 > but it looks neutron ignored this filter and returned the whole
 > list.
 > 
 > $ curl -g -X GET "http://10.0.0.15:9696/v2.0/networks?qos_policy_id=2e994cd9-dd32-490f-8c9a-1629cf7c8aa2"
 > -H "Accept: application/json" -H "X-Auth-Token: $TOKEN"

Ok, thx for checking that :)'}]

commit_message:
Annotate all the filter parameters for networks

Add a 'is_filter' keyword for each network's attribute that can be
used as filter. In the future, we will rely on this to perform
filter validation: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554368/ .

Change-Id: I0cdc1ff482d4ff7ec6afa391392c27c2c099cc0e
Related-Bug: #1749820

horizon pep8 job due to the new rules.

commit_message:
Fix pep8 errors

Recent pep8 upgrade and corresponding pycodestyle update break
horizon pep8 job due to the new rules.

This commit fixes the following new errors:
- E226 missing whitespace around arithmetic operator
- E241 multiple spaces after ','
- E731 do not assign a lambda expression, use a def

The following errors are added to the ignore list
as there are many errors:
- E402 module level import not at top of file
- W503 line break before binary operator

Conflicts:
    openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/aggregates/tests.py
    openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/instances/tests.py
    openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/routers/tests.py
    openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/networks/tests.py
    openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/routers/tests.py

Change-Id: I3478b0684175d2604bbcc1d89cbfca298b97f1e1
(cherry picked from commit f545272f129b8310fa44084cef0e23770c20f9dc)

commit_message:
Use vios_uuids to process required vioses for iSCSI

Proposed changes are to improve the performance by processing
the (dis)connect volume only for active VIOS. This is a
follow-on to [1].

[1] c614c3a9a73641b905ac21f0d17a8deb7149812b
Change-Id: I55b77678fd727b9cacf8993b08caeacf67691b35
(cherry picked from commit 7cda551277a0bf1a58ec65db26d50ea385db1108)

commit_message:
Add ability to iterate over dispatchable methods/endpoints

Add a iter_endpoints() method that can be responded to with
details about the dispatcher, including what endpoints it
can call, what targets each endpoint has and details about
the endpoint that can be useful for introspecting a server.

To get this info from a server all that should be needed
is to do:

  server = get_rpc_server(...)
  for endpoint, target, methods in server.dispatcher.iter_endpoints():
     ....

Change-Id: I4e29025f33d740bf4bf49a0d1b6ec0495d6a2ea5

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-09 14:29:06.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid dumping stack on BuildAbortException

While debugging something I noticed that we are dumping stack when we
intentionally abort a build. When we raise BuildAbortException, it means
we have caught some situation and are handling it, setting error states
and such. We do not need to dump stack in that situation, and doing so
pollutes the logs. We already dump stack when we catch an unexpected
exception in the same path, which makes sense.

This just changes that LOG.exception to LOG.error and adds a trivial
test verification to make it clear that it is the behavior we want.

Change-Id: I4e3343f250ee563e87001b0e17ab19dc872caa66
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid dumping stack on BuildAbortException

While debugging something I noticed that we are dumping stack when we
intentionally abort a build. When we raise BuildAbortException, it means
we have caught some situation and are handling it, setting error states
and such. We do not need to dump stack in that situation, and doing so
pollutes the logs. We already dump stack when we catch an unexpected
exception in the same path, which makes sense.

This just changes that LOG.exception to LOG.error and adds a trivial
test verification to make it clear that it is the behavior we want.

Change-Id: I4e3343f250ee563e87001b0e17ab19dc872caa66

StorageCenter/ScVolumeFolder/GetList payload filter options. In

the API.

commit_message:
Dell EMC SC: Find volume folder API call fails on root folders

Changes to the SC API have changed how calls are made to the
StorageCenter/ScVolumeFolder/GetList payload filter options. In
the case of a folder under root this call could fail depending on
the API.

Change-Id: I2ab2160478d2163dbb45175aa5f1b884f316db24
(cherry picked from commit c9a7fb8da533251772b79140c7161b393c52f15b)

commit_message:
Switch to concurrent.futures for container prepare/upload

Using process based concurrency doesn't work with mistral's threading
model. Switching to concurrent.futures allows the threading executor
to be used instead.

Change-Id: I2c7a1a7cb8d8e195e041b5b185c1ceba3a6d0e86

commit_message:
Pin pycodestyle to <=2.3.1

2.4.0 broke our pep8 tests pretty hard:
http://logs.openstack.org/20/531320/14/check/openstack-tox-pep8/c9d9d10/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-04-10_15_43_40_014738

Pin pycodestyle until we have time to fix all of those.

Note that this is in the global-requirements blacklist to allow
projects to manage those versions on their own:
https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/b94a4e8c8fadbdc4c5cac9c4da6755a3c06a7824/blacklist.txt#L13

Conflicts:
    test-requirements.txt

Change-Id: I6b0d458c702684779eb21e7022dd0f3193ac72d2
Story: 2001819
(cherry picked from commit fc15be6e329a41ab4cf634c53a54441694c41195)

commit_message:
Mapping HAProxy process to CPU core

Enable feature to allow spawn haproxy
processes on more than one core which provides
better performance.

Change-Id: Ie8cc2c4dc59a77b6183d5fedce91d03fc1a03e79
Closes-Bug: #1650270

commit_message:
Allow to clone extras if zuul cloner is not presented

Now zuul cloner executable is required to clone quickstart-extras.
If it's not presented the deployment fails with:
ERROR! .quickstart/playbooks/quickstart-extras.yml could not be found

This patch allows to clone the repository anyway with the standard git
command.

Change-Id: Idc7d59ecffbdaa38c35f44dfef5891b8fb6e199a
Closes-bug: #1754498

commit_message:
Add disable_drivers config option

This commit adds the new option 'disabled_drivers' config option
to support disabling of specific drivers if not needed.

Usage:
disabled_drivers = plexxi, murano

Partially-Implements blueprint enable-drivers-by-default

commit_message:
Remove direct tag / branch ACLs for official projects

The TC confirmed that creating tags (or branches) for repositories
in official deliverables should be handled by the release management
team through the openstack/releases repository.

Yet some ACLs still allow for direct tagging or creating references
by some other teams, which can cause process disruption.

This removes tagging and branch-creating rights for official
deliverables that are already handled by the release management team,
or which never released in the past.

The tool that generated this patch (and contains the list of remaining
team and repository exceptions to the rule) will be posted to the
releases repository.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/557737
Change-Id: I9feea4a59fccec940a36a7953d35a6f734d86582

commit_message:
Move charts to use dependency resolver to define dependencies var

This proposes using the dependency resolver util to define vars
for a template's dependencies, which can then be extended later
to include dynamic vars via the helm-toolkit resolver util if
needed

Change-Id: I5656255fabdda8904e9a5438e86bcec5d2e19f1b

[{'created': '2018-03-22 11:50:08.000000000', 'message': 'Add upper constraint for setuptool >=39 on stable/newton

OpenStack stable/newton and older is now incompatible with the latest
version of setuptools so we need to add an upper constraint to prevent
us installing a version that is too new. Setuptools version 39.0.0
removes the ability to index the result of parse_version which is used
by oslo_utils.versionutils and therefore breaks anyone using those
utility functions.

Change-Id: I93e940538a943fba2d426a714a187e7f6390ceab
'}]
commit_message:
Add upper constraint for setuptool >=39 on stable/newton

OpenStack stable/newton and older is now incompatible with the latest
version of setuptools so we need to add an upper constraint to prevent
us installing a version that is too new. Setuptools version 39.0.0
removes the ability to index the result of parse_version which is used
by oslo_utils.versionutils and therefore breaks anyone using those
utility functions.

Change-Id: I93e940538a943fba2d426a714a187e7f6390ceab

commit_message:
Pin pycodestyle to <=2.3.1

2.4.0 broke our pep8 tests pretty hard:
http://logs.openstack.org/20/531320/14/check/openstack-tox-pep8/c9d9d10/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-04-10_15_43_40_014738

Pin pycodestyle until we have time to fix all of those.

Note that this is in the global-requirements blacklist to allow
projects to manage those versions on their own:
https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/b94a4e8c8fadbdc4c5cac9c4da6755a3c06a7824/blacklist.txt#L13

Conflicts:
    test-requirements.txt

Change-Id: I6b0d458c702684779eb21e7022dd0f3193ac72d2
Story: 2001819
(cherry picked from commit fc15be6e329a41ab4cf634c53a54441694c41195)

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I1c31b9390f7efb53a40559a12c49c1d418b9130a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
zuul: Make ovsfw tempest job voting

It's been tracked for a while and considered stable as per Grafana
dashboard its failure rate is along with other tempest jobs. This patch
makes the job voting in the check queue and not putting to gate queue on
purpose.

Change-Id: I18101cdb864ea28f711d225f74d607d70548a129

commit_message:
Fixes missing 'flat' network type for ODL OVS

The allowed network types were missing 'flat', which will allow nodes to
attach nova instances to flat networks.  This should be allowed by
default.

Partial-Bug: 1762495

Change-Id: Iccee353763823fddd18dc6bbbd857a71f1c2320a
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix incompatible requirement in requirement.txt

Requirement for package eventlet has an exclusion not found in
the global list: set(['<0.21.0', '!=0.20.1', '!=0.18.3'])
vs. set(['!=0.20.1', '!=0.18.3'])

Change-Id: Ieb6f40efde78fc0df42c395f0ed650df5b2d0f77

This patch is a fix for the issue B101 assert_used found by bandit
scanner.
As assert functionality could be turned off by the -O option for python
interpreter, assert statements were replaced to raise AssertionError.

The main reasoning for that is rest code after assert could be not
ready for values that assert filters.

commit_message:
Replace assert to raise AssertionError

This patch is a fix for the issue B101 assert_used found by bandit
scanner:
https://docs.openstack.org/bandit/latest/plugins/b101_assert_used.html
As assert functionality could be turned off by the -O option for python
interpreter, assert statements were replaced to raise AssertionError.

The main reasoning for that is rest code after assert could be not
ready for values that assert filters.

Change-Id: I92a871b1b496c96c0c76cb37e4dda51bfc007e38
Related-Bug: #1759250

VMAX docs - miscellaneous clarifications

Short clarification on san_port, All flash licensing
and libvirt -d option.

Closes-Bug: #1757172

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I274bc62bf0cbe19410cd8ef9e09365e0bf9681ce
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Fix gate: PEP8 and ovs-master jobs

This patch is fixing the by:

1. Update code to reflect stricter PEP8 handling

2. Adding a /bin/bash in front of the ovn-ctl commands.

The reason for 2. still unknown to me, perhaps something has changed in
Ubuntu Xenial (it doens't fail on CentOS for example) which was causing
the error below:

$ /usr/local/share/openvswitch/scripts/ovn-ctl --no-monitor start_northd
/usr/local/share/openvswitch/scripts/ovn-ctl: 1: local: -vfile:info: bad
variable name

This patch also includes a workaround in devstack/lib/networking-ovn
module to prevent OVS from running "make check-docs" which is currently
failing due to
https://mail.openvswitch.org/pipermail/ovs-dev/2018-April/345936.html

Change-Id: I9dca4ba494082a0bf37833b13b05609c715a492d

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-10 06:31:01.000000000', 'message': "Fix strip() when discovering theme templates

When using a custom template which eg. overrides the 500.html template
via openstack_dashboard/themes/templ-name/templates/500.html, the
function file_discovery.populate_horizon_config() populates the
variable 'external_templates' to ['templates/500.html']. In that case,
the split does not work and fails with:

(templates_part, override_path) = theme_file.split('/templates/')
ValueError: need more than 1 value to unpack

because 'external_templates' does not start with a '/'.

Closes-Bug: #1703296
Change-Id: Iaf8f7ef8e9362f5c7e72909477dde36a05401968
"}, {'created': '2017-08-30 04:41:22.000000000', 'message': "Fix strip() when discovering theme templates

"}, {'created': '2017-08-30 11:47:35.000000000', 'message': "Fix strip() when discovering theme templates

When using a custom template which eg. overrides the 500.html template
via openstack_dashboard/themes/templ-name/templates/500.html, the
function file_discovery.populate_horizon_config() populates the
variable 'external_templates' to ['templates/500.html']. In that case,
the split does not work and fails with:

(templates_part, override_path) = theme_file.split('/templates/')
ValueError: need more than 1 value to unpack

because 'external_templates' does not start with a '/'. So split the
path and remove leading '/templates/' or 'templates/' from the
override_path.

Closes-Bug: #1703296
Change-Id: Iaf8f7ef8e9362f5c7e72909477dde36a05401968
"}]
commit_message:
Fix strip() when discovering theme templates

When using a custom template which eg. overrides the 500.html template
via openstack_dashboard/themes/templ-name/templates/500.html, the
function file_discovery.populate_horizon_config() populates the
variable 'external_templates' to ['templates/500.html']. In that case,
the split does not work and fails with:

(templates_part, override_path) = theme_file.split('/templates/')
ValueError: need more than 1 value to unpack

because 'external_templates' does not start with a '/'. So split the
path and remove leading '/templates/' or 'templates/' from the
override_path.

Closes-Bug: #1703296
Change-Id: Iaf8f7ef8e9362f5c7e72909477dde36a05401968

Wording for the volume migration was not very clear. This reworks
that text to be a little more concise. It also removes an OSC arg
that does not actually do anything.

Change-Id: Id75bd6b4445fcf8042d87578f5f692958a859c0b
'}]
commit_message:
Clarify volume migration CLI reference

Wording for the volume migration was not very clear. This reworks
that text to be a little more concise. It also removes an OSC arg
that does not actually do anything.

Change-Id: Id75bd6b4445fcf8042d87578f5f692958a859c0b

commit_message:
Cleanup volume management CLI reference

This puts this documentation into a little more logical order. It
also cleans up some omissions and formatting issues as well as
removes some commentary not appropriate for this documentation.

Change-Id: I4107c7909e0983d51ab7da7c8e66473b6fd44166

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-09 10:53:27.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Allow to specify granular CPU feature flags

The recent "Meltdown" CVE fixes have resulted in a critical performance
penalty[*] that will impact every Nova guest with certain CPU models.

I.e. assume you have applied all the "Meltdown" CVE fixes, and performed
a cold reboot (explicit stop & start) of all Nova guests, for the
updates to take effect.  Now, if any guests that are booted with certain
named virtual CPU models (e.g. "IvyBridge", "Westmere", etc), then those
guests, will incur noticeable performance degradation[*], while being
protected from the CVE itself.

To alleviate this guest performance impact, it is now important to
specify an obscure Intel CPU feature flag, 'PCID' (Process-Context ID)
-- for the virtual CPU models that don't already include it (more on
this below).  To that end, this change will allow Nova to explicitly
specify CPU feature flags via a new configuration attribute,
`cpu_model_extra_flags`, e.g. in `nova.conf`:

    ...
    [libvirt]
    cpu_mode = custom
    cpu_model = IvyBridge
    cpu_model_extra_flags = pcid
    ...

NB: In the first iteration, the choices for `cpu_model_extra_flags` is
restricted to only 'pcid' (the option is case-insensitive) -- to address
the earlier mentioned guest performance degradation.  A future patch
will remove this restriction, allowing to add / remove multiple CPU
feature flags, thus making way for other useful features.

Some have asked: "Why not simply hardcode the 'PCID' CPU feature flag
into Nova?"  That's not graceful, and more importantly, impractical:

  (1) Not every Intel CPU model has 'PCID':

       - The only Intel CPU models that include the 'PCID' capability
         are: "Haswell", "Broadwell", and "Skylake" variants.

       - The libvirt / QEMU Intel CPU models: "Nehalem", "Westmere",
         "SandyBridge", and "IvyBridge" will *not* expose the 'PCID'
         capability, even if the host CPUs by the same name include it.
         I.e. 'PCID' needs to be explicitly when using the said virtual
         CPU models.

  (2) Magically adding new CPU feature flags under the user's feet
      impacts live migration.

[*] https://groups.google.com/forum/m/#!topic/mechanical-sympathy/L9mHTbeQLNU

Closes-Bug: #1750829
Change-Id: I6bb956808aa3df58747c865c92e5b276e61aff44
BluePrint: libvirt-cpu-model-extra-flags
(cherry picked from commit 6b601b7cf6e7f23077f428353a3a4e81084eb3a1)

       - The only Intel CPU models that include the 'PCID' capability

       - The libvirt / QEMU Intel CPU models: "Nehalem", "Westmere",
