messages:
[{'account_id': 21151, 'date': '2018-03-28 06:08:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-03-28 06:15:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 21151, 'date': '2018-03-28 09:53:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This is to add ovs user creation in tripleo-packages templates, it shall be applied to master and pike which support update_tasks.

For newton and ocata, another patch[1] is proposed to add ovs user creation in yum_update.sh since there is a special case handler for ovs package update.
[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/557164/

We might also need [1] for pike as it supports both update patch (update_tasks, yum_update.sh)?'}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2018-03-28 15:54:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 21151, 'date': '2018-03-28 22:22:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Sergii,

Thanks for the comments!
Yes, ideally this should be fixed in package itself like you have pointed out (adding a section of preinstall scriptlet to create openvswitch user), but we're about to support ovs2.9 in osp10 and cannot wait until the fix is landed in ovs which takes a long time.
This is to add a workaround in tripleo to create user before doing package update and shall be deleted once ovs has the fix ready."}, {'account_id': 21151, 'date': '2018-03-30 01:55:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11391, 'date': '2018-03-31 19:02:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 21151, 'date': '2018-04-02 01:23:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

Thanks for the comments!'}, {'account_id': 11391, 'date': '2018-04-02 11:26:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Thank you for clarifying! In that case you're right, for sure. On the other hand I don't understand why they did that in the rpm spec... I'm going to discuss this solution with ovs folks :)"}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2018-04-03 14:35:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2018-04-03 17:08:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I checked openvswitch package

Here are the results

(undercloud) [stack@undercloud ~]$ rpm -qi openvswitch
Name        : openvswitch
Epoch       : 1
Version     : 2.9.0
Release     : 3.el7
Architecture: x86_64
Install Date: Tue 03 Apr 2018 04:07:45 PM UTC
Group       : Unspecified
Size        : 21984020
License     : ASL 2.0 and LGPLv2+ and SISSL
Signature   : (none)
Source RPM  : openvswitch-2.9.0-3.el7.src.rpm
Build Date  : Fri 16 Mar 2018 10:06:00 PM UTC
Build Host  : c1be.rdu2.centos.org
Relocations : (not relocatable)
Packager    : CBS <cbs@centos.org>
Vendor      : CentOS
URL         : http://www.openvswitch.org/
Summary     : Open vSwitch daemon/database/utilities
Description :
Open vSwitch provides standard network bridging functions and
support for the OpenFlow protocol for remote per-flow control of
traffic.
(undercloud) [stack@undercloud ~]$ rpm -q --scripts openvswitch
postinstall scriptlet (using /bin/sh):
if [ $1 -eq 1 ]; then
    getent passwd openvswitch >/dev/null || \
        useradd -r -d / -s /sbin/nologin -c "Open vSwitch Daemons" openvswitch

    sed -i 's:^#OVS_USER_ID=:OVS_USER_ID=:' /etc/sysconfig/openvswitch

    getent group hugetlbfs >/dev/null || \
        groupadd hugetlbfs
    usermod -a -G hugetlbfs openvswitch
    sed -i \
        's@OVS_USER_ID="openvswitch:openvswitch"@OVS_USER_ID="openvswitch:hugetlbfs"@'\
        /etc/sysconfig/openvswitch

    # In the case of upgrade, this is not needed.
    chown -R openvswitch:openvswitch /etc/openvswitch
fi


if [ $1 -eq 1 ] ; then
        # Initial installation
        systemctl preset openvswitch.service >/dev/null 2>&1 || :
fi
preuninstall scriptlet (using /bin/sh):

if [ $1 -eq 0 ] ; then
        # Package removal, not upgrade
        systemctl --no-reload disable openvswitch.service > /dev/null 2>&1 || :
        systemctl stop openvswitch.service > /dev/null 2>&1 || :
fi
postuninstall scriptlet (using /bin/sh):

systemctl daemon-reload >/dev/null 2>&1 || :'}, {'account_id': 21151, 'date': '2018-04-11 08:14:02.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Abandoning this patch as master doesn't need this change (fresh installation of ovs in master will have the right permission set, no need to patch it separately)."}]

commit_message:
Ensure openvswitch user exist before package update

Ovs uses openvswitch user when updating package to 2.8
onwards, but openvswitch user is not exist and will not
be created during package update. This is going to add
workaround to make sure openvswitch user exist before
running package update.

Related-Bug: #1759982
Change-Id: I08c3a0188cd9a973ff5f5721918b257c472067f3

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-06-05 04:32:05.000000000', 'message': 'Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I85a803e2b6e35f15d0901b5a91a9ba80365c6dcb
'}]
commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I85a803e2b6e35f15d0901b5a91a9ba80365c6dcb

commit_message:
Replace the usage of some aliases in tempest

In tempest, following aliases have been moved in version Pike
and will be removed in version Queens:ad
* manager > os_primary [1]
* admin_manager > os_admin [2]
* os_adm > os_admin [3]
* os > os_primary [4]
* alt_manager > os_alt [5]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/468036/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/467852/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/467605/
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/466991/
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/457555/

Change-Id: I441f90fb2e5bdaa0fb22295a9ab03e8dcecdedcf

commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I0a19ab4bee70927d0c910b5b3f5720c0edc85ec4

[{'created': '2018-04-10 18:28:37.000000000', 'message': 'exclude cmd2 0.8.3 and update to 0.8.4

Release 0.8.3 of cmd2 failed to properly specify a new dependency so
installing it breaks interactive mode for OSC and other cliff-based
apps. 0.8.4 fixes the issue.

Change-Id: If9d7af11865c2031960905b5902223aa28dcd449
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-04-10 20:11:29.000000000', 'message': 'exclude cmd2 0.8.3

installing it breaks interactive mode for OSC and other cliff-based
apps.

Change-Id: If9d7af11865c2031960905b5902223aa28dcd449
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
exclude cmd2 0.8.3

Release 0.8.3 of cmd2 failed to properly specify a new dependency so
installing it breaks interactive mode for OSC and other cliff-based
apps.

Change-Id: If9d7af11865c2031960905b5902223aa28dcd449
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

messages: [{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-04-11 00:09:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-04-11 00:16:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2018-04-11 05:47:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-11 00:09:57.000000000', 'message': "swift-(account|container)-info: tolerate LockTimeouts

I'm not really clear on why a sqlite3.OperationalError should cause us to
retry with stale_reads_ok=True, but swift.common.exceptions.LockTimeout
*definitely* should.

Change-Id: I707dec1d11b8db80bc8fbee30662b319bf10d6a5
"}]
commit_message:
swift-(account|container)-info: tolerate LockTimeouts

I'm not really clear on why a sqlite3.OperationalError should cause us to
retry with stale_reads_ok=True, but swift.common.exceptions.LockTimeout
*definitely* should.

Change-Id: I707dec1d11b8db80bc8fbee30662b319bf10d6a5

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-10 16:45:28.000000000', 'message': 'Fix a nit in the oooq transformation process.

This would result in a file having the compute node and the
environment files on the same line:

  --compute-scale 0  -e /opt/stack/new/tripleo-ci/test-environments/worker-config.yaml \

which could lead later on to improper parsing[1]

[1] https://logs.rdoproject.org/55/559755/3/openstack-check/gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-container-to-container-upgrades-master-nv/Zd4c2be456ed34d239b58e830288b2421/undercloud/home/jenkins/overcloud_upgrade_prepare.sh.txt.gz

Change-Id: I5e9cf01e706411406b953d4c1a8e7443b328edd2
'}]
commit_message:
Fix a nit in the oooq transformation process.

This would result in a file having the compute node and the
environment files on the same line:

  --compute-scale 0  -e /opt/stack/new/tripleo-ci/test-environments/worker-config.yaml \

which could lead later on to improper parsing[1]

[1] https://logs.rdoproject.org/55/559755/3/openstack-check/gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-container-to-container-upgrades-master-nv/Zd4c2be456ed34d239b58e830288b2421/undercloud/home/jenkins/overcloud_upgrade_prepare.sh.txt.gz

Change-Id: I5e9cf01e706411406b953d4c1a8e7443b328edd2

commit_message:
[Optimise] Use ThreadGroup to manage periodic tasks

Instead of manually managing periodic tasks, use
oslo.service's threadgroup to make it easier to
stop them.

[1]: https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.service/latest/reference/threadgroup.html

Change-Id: Ia584b9fafcc9e73f747dbba563be4fdca8d565ea

commit_message:
Follow the new PTI for document build

For compliance with the Project Testing Interface as described in:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html

Remove [build_sphinx] as described in:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128594.html

Change-Id: Ib1059403dccf7a58e8a8554c1298a601c2c067a2

commit_message:
Add endpoint map environment without TLS

This will be useful for cases when folks disable TLS in the t-h-t
configuration (both for the t-h-t undercloud or the overcloud.

Change-Id: Ia4fb60e2e88cd0f28dd254bb18b3959a9732a7ce

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-10 15:58:03.000000000', 'message': 'Added network enabled check in multiple nic role rendering file

Without this check, even though network is disabled in
network_data file, network configuration is present in role file.

Change-Id: I03c361f3549f2d0bb9367f7fcd77349b3249fa70
Closes-Bug: 1761484
(cherry picked from commit 1cc26fba5b9a86bf5d4e9718e773558e76607843)
'}]
commit_message:
Added network enabled check in multiple nic role rendering file

Without this check, even though network is disabled in
network_data file, network configuration is present in role file.

Change-Id: I03c361f3549f2d0bb9367f7fcd77349b3249fa70
Closes-Bug: 1761484
(cherry picked from commit 1cc26fba5b9a86bf5d4e9718e773558e76607843)

commit_message:
fixing wrong designate producer image used in deploy

This patch changes the wrong designate producer image
from "{{ designate_central_image }}:{{ designate_central_tag }}"
to "{{ designate_producer_image }}:{{ designate_producer_tag }}"

Change-Id: I8eabd47b14eb698676acbcc20141fa81c663422b
Closes-bug:1759629
(cherry picked from commit c5ee7519ba4e34f9d0e9ed46813e35dfb5be90e7)

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 18368, 'date': '2018-03-28 15:37:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

no need to test kolla_internal_fqdn and kolla_external_fqdn  too ?'}, {'account_id': 24147, 'date': '2018-03-28 15:55:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> no need to test kolla_internal_fqdn and kolla_external_fqdn  too ?

I believe the requirement here is that the fqdn needs to match the CN or subject alternative name specified in the certificate.  Verifying that would require parsing the certificate which seems like a lot of effort for minimal gain to me.  The default fqdn values (which default to the respective VIP addresses) may be sufficient for a test environment so I don't think we can simply check that they are set."}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-04-03 07:15:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

can use same interface with tls enabled, been running with it for a while and no issue so far found. Whats the errors you having? 

There is also logic to handle diff interfaces in keepalived config file https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/roles/haproxy/templates/keepalived.conf.j2#L18'}, {'account_id': 24147, 'date': '2018-04-03 12:37:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> can use same interface with tls enabled, been running with it for a
 > while and no issue so far found. Whats the errors you having?
 > 
 
Same interface or same VIP?  I've run it on the same interface but not successfully with the same VIP.

I can't remember the exact error I saw off the top of my head but I know I had issues in this config connecting to horizon (port 80 redirects to 443, but I couldn't connect over 443 and don't remember the error - I'd have to retest).

If you are correct and this works, then we should fix the doc which says the VIPs must be different:
https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/doc/source/admin/advanced-configuration.rst#tls-configuration"}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-04-03 13:00:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

sorry, misread the change'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-04-03 13:00:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Verify external VIP set when TLS enabled.

The documentation states that kolla_internal_vip_address and
kolla_external_vip_address must be different when TLS is enabled.
If this is not true, the deploy will be successful but will not
function correctly.  This change adds a precheck to catch this
configuration problem prior to deployment.

Change-Id: I6c9e5fd5f434f7225bd0390aff116fa12da96934

commit_message:
Revert "Deploy container-multinode (fs010) with a containerized undercloud"

This reverts commit f61f8d0e60072b31878f795983e6862bbb955eb1.

tripleo-common patches aren't being tested since this merged to convert
the undercloud to containers on March 29th. Nothing updates the mistral
container to use the tripleo-common code being tested.

Change-Id: I2cb7d59ab1f42bfa6d852213b792b428a75c4fcc
Partial-Bug: #1762422

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-10 15:59:42.000000000', 'message': "Fix pep8 errors

Recent pep8 upgrade and corresponding pycodestyle update break
horizon pep8 job due to the new rules.

This commit fixes the following new errors:
- E266 too many leading '#' for block comment
- E501 line too long
- H903  Windows style line endings not allowed in code

The following errors are added to the ignore list
as there are many errors:
- E402 module level import not at top of file
- E731 do not assign a lambda expression, use a def
- W503 line break before binary operator

Change-Id: I1fd3357479bb2ba3d89de92739ffac99900761b6
"}, {'created': '2018-04-10 16:11:02.000000000', 'message': "Fix pep8 errors

Recent pep8 upgrade and corresponding pycodestyle update break
pep8 job due to the new rules.

This commit fixes the following new errors:
- E266 too many leading '#' for block comment
- E501 line too long
- H903  Windows style line endings not allowed in code

The following errors are added to the ignore list
as there are many errors:
- E402 module level import not at top of file
- E731 do not assign a lambda expression, use a def

Change-Id: I1fd3357479bb2ba3d89de92739ffac99900761b6
"}]
commit_message:
Fix pep8 errors

Recent pep8 upgrade and corresponding pycodestyle update break
pep8 job due to the new rules.

This commit fixes the following new errors:
- E266 too many leading '#' for block comment
- E501 line too long
- H903  Windows style line endings not allowed in code

The following errors are added to the ignore list
as there are many errors:
- E402 module level import not at top of file
- E731 do not assign a lambda expression, use a def
- W503 line break before binary operator

Change-Id: I1fd3357479bb2ba3d89de92739ffac99900761b6

[{'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2016-03-21 12:10:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2016-03-21 12:14:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'd like to see some documentation on why you want to do this and how to use it.

This is the first project doing something like that, so I'd like to fully understand your plan to verify that the change you do implements it properly."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-03-21 12:18:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

Build failed (check pipeline).  For information on how to proceed, see http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#automated-testing

- gate-bindep-fallback-devstack-centos7 http://logs.openstack.org/53/295253/1/check/gate-bindep-fallback-devstack-centos7/85600e2/ : SUCCESS in 1m 39s
- gate-bindep-fallback-fedora-23 http://logs.openstack.org/53/295253/1/check/gate-bindep-fallback-fedora-23/cb1aa1a/ : SUCCESS in 2m 41s
- gate-bindep-fallback-ubuntu-trusty http://logs.openstack.org/53/295253/1/check/gate-bindep-fallback-ubuntu-trusty/148bf3c/ : SUCCESS in 2m 34s

- gate-project-config-layout http://logs.openstack.org/53/295253/1/check/gate-project-config-layout/e885500/ : SUCCESS in 7m 34s'}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2016-03-21 12:22:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sure - I got the idea when Amrith send the "tagging reviews" mail to the -dev list.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-March/089796.html

What I would like to do is have an extra section or 2 in the designate gerrit dashboard 
that would have reviews with +1 / +2 Review-Priority highlighted.

This would say maintaining an etherpad, passing links in IRC or the other "starred-by" filters that 
other projects use.

Having the label would make the extra section much easier, just adding "label:Review-Priority=2" to a
standard query would do the trick.'}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2016-03-21 13:48:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-03-21 14:00:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

Build failed (check pipeline).  For information on how to proceed, see http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#automated-testing

- gate-bindep-fallback-devstack-centos7 http://logs.openstack.org/53/295253/2/check/gate-bindep-fallback-devstack-centos7/96bd3be/ : SUCCESS in 1m 07s
- gate-bindep-fallback-fedora-23 http://logs.openstack.org/53/295253/2/check/gate-bindep-fallback-fedora-23/43f1d40/ : SUCCESS in 2m 07s
- gate-bindep-fallback-ubuntu-trusty http://logs.openstack.org/53/295253/2/check/gate-bindep-fallback-ubuntu-trusty/9f834ca/ : SUCCESS in 1m 39s
- gate-project-config-gerrit http://logs.openstack.org/53/295253/2/check/gate-project-config-gerrit/b088e62/ : FAILURE in 2m 10s
- gate-project-config-layout http://logs.openstack.org/53/295253/2/check/gate-project-config-layout/ab62d79/ : SUCCESS in 7m 35s'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2016-03-21 14:44:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

This solution seems suboptimal but I'm fairly neutral on whether it's a safe experiment, so +1 rather than +2 from me.

Keep in mind that if one designate-core sets Review-Priority +2 and then disappears (on holiday or whatever), other designate-core reviewers can't downgrade that to +1 or 0 since the only account which can replace a vote is the account which made it. Also querying may not work as anticipated with conflicting votes if you match on specific values rather than inequalities. Further, votes get "unmapped" in odd ways when reviewers are removed from a group which had permission to add them, so you may find that taking someone out of designate-core has the effect of "un-prioritizing" reviews which they previously set as priorities.

Other teams are currently collaborating on a more dynamic solution involving automated generation of dashboards published into Gerrit which can include metrics like associated bug priority, involvement in implementing an approved spec, et cetera.'}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2016-03-21 15:12:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Yeap - I am going to track the other dashboard efforts as well.

I think this is a good way for us to flag arbritary reviews on 
top of a generated dashboard.

For removing the +1/+2 there is the option of granting the "Remove Reviewer" permission,
but that can be revisited if we need it in the future.

If it fails as an experiment, we can remove it in the future'}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2016-03-21 15:12:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-03-21 15:30:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified-1

commit_message:
Create 'Review-Priority' for designate repos

This allows anyone in the group "designate-release-manager"
to set the priority of patches, and block non freeze patches
during RC.

This allows for more precise dashboard than relying
on stars from PTLs, and allows the team to distingush
between a procedural -2 and a release freeze -2.

Change-Id: Id7b4c6b219899fa7ed86554257264af7efe20408

commit_message:
Disk quota checking missed 'prjquota'

When set disk quota to prjquota for overlay2 xfs,
the checking supported disk quota will miss it.

Change-Id: I2246799e6e8fb34c64a5dcfe8daf43c2b31e5a4d
Closes-Bug: #1761118

commit_message:
Bump up sphinx version to '>=1.6.2,!=1.6.6'

In masakari-specs, now requirements.txt specifies
'sphinx!=1.3b1,<1.4,>=1.2.1'. But in global-requirements, it specifies
'sphinx>=1.6.2,!=1.6.6'. It is inconsistent with one another.
It had better to adjust the version due to build the document without
virtualenv.

Change-Id: I0ba1cb1497bb45073359c902656f830316d0174f

commit_message:
Ship files like other openstack projects

For packagers, it's useful to have consistency.
This patch ensures the api-paste is shipped with masakari as
data files, like other projects do: [1], [2], [3].

In this patch, I also added the policy.json file, because
the policy is not yet in code.

Configuration files are not to be shipped with this manner,
as they are generated.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/setup.cfg#L28
[2]: https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/setup.cfg#L20
[3]: https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/setup.cfg#L26

Change-Id: I67aaca1da57909746766dc495b2009fb60feffd0

[{'created': '2018-04-07 22:53:23.000000000', 'message': "Add a note about configuration of ws url

The common problems that users ran into is that they are not
able to access the container's console in browser (via Horizon).
The reason is that the ws_proxy's URL is not accessible from
the browser. Either the configured IP address is not accessible
from outside or the port was blocked. This patch adds a note to
explain how to configure the websocket proxy's URL propertly.

commit_message:
Add a note about configuration of ws url

The common problems that users ran into is that they are not
able to access the container's console in browser (via Horizon).
The reason is that the ws_proxy's URL is not accessible from
the browser. Either the configured IP address is not accessible
from outside or the port was blocked. This patch adds a note to
explain how to configure the websocket proxy's URL propertly.

Change-Id: Ifac45550f22409c2348e1b14ff46606a7bf09a89

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-06 21:30:05.000000000', 'message': "Don't set deployments as hostvars

This patch updates config-download to not create a vars file under
group_vars for the server deployments. These variables end up as
hostvars in Ansible, which has caused many escaping problems since
hostvars are run through the templating engine.

In combination with I06c9b3256567cc57d599bd4d9af617c718d2314f, these
escaping problems should be eliminated.

Additionally, by not using hostvars (set_fact), we can save memory since
a hostvar is set on a host and persisted in memory. With many hosts and
large deployments (such as all hiera data), this would have eventually
been an issue.

Instead, an Ansible lookup is used in deployments.yaml to read
deployment data, which are now written to individual files by
config-download. This also improves readability instead of having one
big file of all deployment data.

Change-Id: Ie09fc64cf85eb532f31684f1c9808b942672ff41
Closes-Bug: #1760990
"}, {'created': '2018-04-07 18:50:05.000000000', 'message': "Don't set deployments as hostvars

large deployments (such as all hiera data), this would have eventually

big file of all deployment data.

Change-Id: Ie09fc64cf85eb532f31684f1c9808b942672ff41
Depends-On: I01c273af7a30855ee87776556f6a40db01cc14b2
Closes-Bug: #1760990
"}, {'created': '2018-04-09 19:46:13.000000000', 'message': "Don't set deployments as hostvars

This patch updates config-download to not create a vars file under
group_vars for the server deployments. These variables end up as
hostvars in Ansible, which has caused many escaping problems since
hostvars are run through the templating engine.

In combination with I06c9b3256567cc57d599bd4d9af617c718d2314f, these

Additionally, by not using hostvars (set_fact), we can save memory since
a hostvar is set on a host and persisted in memory. With many hosts and
large deployments (such as all hiera data), this would have eventually
been an issue.

Instead, an Ansible lookup is used in deployments.yaml to read

Change-Id: Ie09fc64cf85eb532f31684f1c9808b942672ff41
Closes-Bug: #1760990

commit_message:
Don't set deployments as hostvars

This patch updates config-download to not create a vars file under
group_vars for the server deployments. These variables end up as
hostvars in Ansible, which has caused many escaping problems since
hostvars are run through the templating engine.

In combination with I06c9b3256567cc57d599bd4d9af617c718d2314f, these
escaping problems should be eliminated.

Additionally, by not using hostvars (set_fact), we can save memory since
a hostvar is set on a host and persisted in memory. With many hosts and
large deployments (such as all hiera data), this would have eventually
been an issue.

Instead, an Ansible lookup is used in deployments.yaml to read
deployment data, which are now written to individual files by
config-download. This also improves readability instead of having one
big file of all deployment data.

Change-Id: Ie09fc64cf85eb532f31684f1c9808b942672ff41
Closes-Bug: #1760990

The 'flat' network type was missing from the default allowed network
types with OpenDaylight deployments.  This is OVS configuration which
detemrines which tenant network types are supported on a per node basis.
By default, flat should be allowed.

Closes-Bug: 1762495

commit_message:
Fix missing allowed network type 'flat' for ODL OVS

The 'flat' network type was missing from the default allowed network
types with OpenDaylight deployments.  This is OVS configuration which
detemrines which tenant network types are supported on a per node basis.
By default, flat should be allowed.

Closes-Bug: 1762495

Change-Id: Idf626948ee46a88f95f020fc12b7cd8b04db8be6
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 186b03d72098858c9d8f1b0b014527ffe9864d72)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-10 15:20:08.000000000', 'message': 'remove optimization for values unchanged from the branch

When a requirement setting is changed, require that all requirements
follow the rules.

Without this change, it is possible to partially update the dependency
list for a project in a way that leaves some of the dependencies out
of compliance. With this change, all dependencies must be compliant in
order to update any of them.

Change-Id: I154245339a36618ac2e9a5922bc37121d44bca29
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
remove optimization for values unchanged from the branch

When a requirement setting is changed, require that all requirements
follow the rules.

Without this change, it is possible to partially update the dependency
list for a project in a way that leaves some of the dependencies out
of compliance. With this change, all dependencies must be compliant in
order to update any of them.

Change-Id: I154245339a36618ac2e9a5922bc37121d44bca29
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

- gate-grenade-dsvm-ironic-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/41/500241/1/check/gate-grenade-dsvm-ironic-ubuntu-xenial/4876ff2/ : SUCCESS in 1h 57m 06s
- gate-grenade-dsvm-ironic-multinode-multitenant-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/41/500241/1/check/gate-grenade-dsvm-ironic-multinode-multitenant-ubuntu-xenial/c63f4c2/ : SUCCESS in 1h 59m 52s
- ironic-coverage-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/41/500241/1/check/ironic-coverage-ubuntu-xenial/c91fd11/ : SUCCESS in 6m 49s'}, {'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2017-09-03 05:34:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Providing duplicate IP address is an operator error. Ironic should not be doing checks for such errors. Ironic might be managing hundreds of nodes and if we were to do such checks, it would reduce overall time of enrollment exponentially. Also, we would have to do such checks for every driver as everyone of them have some BMC information which it uses to connect and if its duplicated across nodes can lead to the same problem described by you. Conductor should not be checking for the IPMI driver specific field 'ipmi_address'/ 'ipmi_port'. May be we should have a driver specific method which could identify the fields that should not be duplicated and then call it from conductor for each node matching that driver."}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2017-09-04 01:38:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Shivanand, thanks for review! I definitly agree with you, the check will increase time of enrollment and node update, and it's also bad for conductor to check against driver related information. A little reservation of the opinion is that, enrollment/update is not a frequently happening operation and we can make it optional by introducing new option.

The reason I bother bringing it here is, operators may make mistakes to provide correct ipmi information, when it happens, ironic neither validates nor provides enough log, making it hard to find out.

ironic do checks for port mac address, user may ask, why not ipmi address? So the first intention of this patch is to make sure whether we want it. If not, simply a Won't Fix is fine.

If there is a need, then we can discuss how to achieve it gracefully (obviously it's not in this patch). By adding a driver specific method as you said, we have to introduce a new driver api, do we agree?

I feel the check does not seem to fit anywhere in ironic, another alternative I have considered is improving client instead of patching ironic, add something like healthy check, dedicated to perform such global checks.

BTW, tempest is not happy with this :/"}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 02:23:09.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

* Verified-1 by Jenkins (3)
'}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2018-04-11 02:57:06.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This is not the right approach, will figure out a way in the future, just no time for this time.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-02 02:50:18.000000000', 'message': 'Check duplicated IPMI address at node create/update

Ironic does not check duplicated ipmi address when creating or updating
nodes, it leads to power sync problems.

As a demonstration, creates node A and B with identical ipmi address,
and sets power state of node A to ON. Node A assumes target power state
to ON, while node B assumes to OFF, the power of the real node will be
switched back and forth during power state synchronization.

This patch check existing ipmi_address (and optionally ipmi_port if
apply) when creating or updating a node.

Change-Id: Id54a1a4c30a74ddd1b4e1a7ddf368faf05fe8112
Closes-Bug: #1713960
'}]
commit_message:
Check duplicated IPMI address at node create/update

Ironic does not check duplicated ipmi address when creating or updating
nodes, it leads to power sync problems.

As a demonstration, creates node A and B with identical ipmi address,
and sets power state of node A to ON. Node A assumes target power state
to ON, while node B assumes to OFF, the power of the real node will be
switched back and forth during power state synchronization.

This patch check existing ipmi_address (and optionally ipmi_port if
apply) when creating or updating a node.

Change-Id: Id54a1a4c30a74ddd1b4e1a7ddf368faf05fe8112
Closes-Bug: #1713960

commit_message:
Modify the message of LOG

"host_state" is a object, we may not get the host name
in the log message, as the following:
<zun.scheduler.host_state.HostState object at 0x7f391c362590>
has not been heard from in a while

Change-Id: Ifb6a4c909923f03ac4079aeb16bf1d64100f597f

commit_message:
Use no TLS environment explicitly

When TLS is not enabled, this explicitly uses the non-TLS endpoint map
explicitly. This way we can overwrite the defaults to use TLS safely.

Depends-On: Ia4fb60e2e88cd0f28dd254bb18b3959a9732a7ce
Change-Id: Ief352f9e54bee95d5e4035725ab6a63ef4be0269

[{'created': '2018-04-10 12:39:12.000000000', 'message': "Allow for single tempest image upload

If 'tempest_images' has been overridden to only contain a single image,
setting a fact for a secondary image will fail since it always expects
'tempest_image_create' to contain two elements. Instead, set the
'tempest_glance_image_id_2' fact as the last element.

Change-Id: If4bbd73f70bfb59695bb7d5f167ed6555e6de16a
(cherry picked from commit 540a6be329d78df6a195bf1749364c6f514cefe9)
"}]
commit_message:
Allow for single tempest image upload

If 'tempest_images' has been overridden to only contain a single image,
setting a fact for a secondary image will fail since it always expects
'tempest_image_create' to contain two elements. Instead, set the
'tempest_glance_image_id_2' fact as the last element.

Change-Id: If4bbd73f70bfb59695bb7d5f167ed6555e6de16a
(cherry picked from commit 540a6be329d78df6a195bf1749364c6f514cefe9)

commit_message:
Move task error handling to function

* Replaces large amounts of repeated code on the task view with a
  _handle_task_error() function
* try and unify error handling to always return a list 'errors' or
  a dict when specific field name errors are known.

Change-Id: I9d140db0af204524eadc4ba3a6d3eb7299b239b4

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-10 21:15:16.000000000', 'message': "Pin pycodestyle to <=2.3.1

This temporarily pins pycodestyle, as 2.4.0 breaks us pretty hard, and
2.3.1 is okay. There's still an open question if this is the right place
to pin it, or if that should be done in hacking or upper-constraints.

Change-Id: I6b0d458c702684779eb21e7022dd0f3193ac72d2
Story: 2001819
"}, {'created': '2018-04-10 21:23:49.000000000', 'message': 'Pin pycodestyle to <=2.3.1

2.4.0 broke our pep8 tests pretty hard:
http://logs.openstack.org/20/531320/14/check/openstack-tox-pep8/c9d9d10/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-04-10_15_43_40_014738

Pin pycodestyle until we have time to fix all of those.

Note that this is in the global-requirements blacklist to allow
projects to manage those versions on their own:
https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/b94a4e8c8fadbdc4c5cac9c4da6755a3c06a7824/blacklist.txt#L13

Change-Id: I6b0d458c702684779eb21e7022dd0f3193ac72d2
Story: 2001819
'}]
commit_message:
Pin pycodestyle to <=2.3.1

2.4.0 broke our pep8 tests pretty hard:
http://logs.openstack.org/20/531320/14/check/openstack-tox-pep8/c9d9d10/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-04-10_15_43_40_014738

Pin pycodestyle until we have time to fix all of those.

Note that this is in the global-requirements blacklist to allow
projects to manage those versions on their own:
https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/b94a4e8c8fadbdc4c5cac9c4da6755a3c06a7824/blacklist.txt#L13

Change-Id: I6b0d458c702684779eb21e7022dd0f3193ac72d2
Story: 2001819

commit_message:
TC Nominations should also be email addresses

Change the TC nominations period kickoff mail in line with
the shift from expecting nominations based on IRC nicks to
email addresses.

Change-Id: I31a0665909d4707095d755db243927dab42b30b1

(3 comments)

So, I'm unable to get this to even start running tests, due to issues with credentials -- it seems to be requesting a ton of accounts for some reason. The old code ran perfectly fine with just 2.

Does this absolutely require more than two accounts (one admin, one member)? How many more am I going to need? Running tempest with admin privileges and letting it create arbitrary accounts in our production clouds is a non-viable option.

https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/configuration.html#pre-provisioned-credentials

commit_message:
Create scenario tests for load balancers

This patch implements the tempest plugin for
for testing load balancer creation in Octavia.

Co-Authored-By: Jude Cross <jcross@godaddy.com>
Co-Authored-By: Lingxian Kong <anlin.kong@gmail.com>

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/557856
Change-Id: I57064f8e0834efba8859a780394a1c69851cc917

commit_message:
Remove python job templates for storyboard

Storyboard has moved its unit test jobs in-repo in order to increase
timeouts on them, so no longer needs the
openstack-python-jobs-no-constraints and
openstack-python35-jobs-no-constraints templates applied here.

Change-Id: I03305070e6cf77ef608367b3991a27af5aaf4c98
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/557801

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Ida3de5ec81c44ac73c1fe4e719a4acbcf69c660e
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Looks good to me too, but will leave it to Tony for the final OK.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-04-10 22:18:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

Thanks Elod!

This is great for right now but during this cycle we need to design the process and display the per-project status rather than this global status.

We designed the policy so there isn't an "ocata" status anymore so consumers will need to look at a projects data/page to determine this.'}]

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2017-08-21 20:33:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm not really sure this change is much better than how it breaks currently...

I don't think a CooperativeRingBuilder is really a thing w/o a CompositeBuilder parent.

I'm pretty sure a deepcopy of a working CooperativeRingBuilder should *not* implicitly fallback to a regular RingBuilder either... although that's probably the most useful thing you could do.

I'm *pretty* keen on just raising an error if you deepcopy a CooperativeRingBuilder.  It would be kinda neat if you could make a deep copy of a whole CompositeBuilder (with it's cooperative builder set) and that worked w/o doing anything stupid.

... but stand alone I'm not sure a deepcopy of a CooperativeRingBuilder makes a lot of sense so an error might be the best we can do."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-08-21 21:13:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

[{'created': '2017-08-21 19:46:00.000000000', 'message': "Fix CooperativeRingBuilder deepcopy

deepcopy of a CooperativeRingBuilder fails because the RingBuilder
superclass implementation attempts to construct an instance using too
few arguments in from_dict().

It doesn't make sense to copy the parent_builder reference when making
a copy, because the parent_builder will not have a reference to the
copy instance in it's co-builders. However, setting parent_builder to
None will result in exceptions if rebalance is ever called on the copy
instance. This patch therefore makes the
CooperativeRingBuilder.__init__() parent_builder optional and if not
given (as it the case in from_dict()) then the CooperativeRingBuilder
instance becomes its own parent_builder, and consequently rebalance
behaves the same as a RingBuilder.

I could not find a deepcopy of a [Cooperative]RingBuilder in the repo
but it may be used in third party code.

Change-Id: Ic9964e6118b557072ae5b9f64d3b242d9abe6035
Related-Change: I1b30cb3d776be441346a4131007d2487a5440a81
"}]
commit_message:
Fix CooperativeRingBuilder deepcopy

deepcopy of a CooperativeRingBuilder fails because the RingBuilder
superclass implementation attempts to construct an instance using too
few arguments in from_dict().

It doesn't make sense to copy the parent_builder reference when making
a copy, because the parent_builder will not have a reference to the
copy instance in it's co-builders. However, setting parent_builder to
None will result in exceptions if rebalance is ever called on the copy
instance. This patch therefore makes the
CooperativeRingBuilder.__init__() parent_builder optional and if not
given (as it the case in from_dict()) then the CooperativeRingBuilder
instance becomes its own parent_builder, and consequently rebalance
behaves the same as a RingBuilder.

I could not find a deepcopy of a [Cooperative]RingBuilder in the repo
but it may be used in third party code.

Change-Id: Ic9964e6118b557072ae5b9f64d3b242d9abe6035
Related-Change: I1b30cb3d776be441346a4131007d2487a5440a81
